listJob.location: Handico Tower. Pham Hung street, Qu·∫≠n Nam T·ª´ Li√™m, H√† N·ªôi
listJob.description:
1. General Description
Research and develop Automotive products (Or related products) based on Android/Linux platforms. Software engineers are involved in developing platforms on almost all software layers.
 2. Essential Duties and Responsibilities
Write clean, human-readable code with unit tests
Develop high-quality code and maintain software source code written in C/C++
Develop and deploy product to Android/Linux hardware.
Analyze and fix software bugs using code coverity tools and testing devices
Create and maintain software documentation
Cooperate with internal organization and 3rd party
Steady efforts to improve SW design and quality
listJob.jobExperience:
3. Working Experience and Knowledge
University degree or above in Computer Science/Electronics/Industrial Engineering or equivalent.
[Mandatory] Have at least 4 years of experience in software development in C/C++
[Mandatory] Have experience in  AOSP/Linux-distro porting, customization
[Mandatory] Have basic understanding of items: Bootloader, Kernel, Driver, HAL
Have good knowledge of Object-Oriented Programming (OOP) and Design Patterns
Have hands-on experience in using JIRA, SVN, GIT
Experiences related to multi-thread, multi-process programming (IPC)
Experiences related to Open Source porting & development & customizing
Experiences on IVI or EV Charging domains
Skills and Abilities
Good English skills in both verbal and written
Thorough, sincere, responsible, understanding mindset
Strong motivation to develop a career in automotive software and car automation
Active communication internally and externally
Good ability in teamwork and working independently
Ability to take business trip/ travel (e.g. Korea, UK, ect.)
listJob.privilege:
1. Benefits
Salary will be negotiated depends on your competency
Competitive compensation package (Basic salary, Monthly Allowance, Performance incentive, Profit Sharing) ~ Up to 15-16 monthly salary/year
Attractive benefits (SHUI Insurance, PTI Premium Health Care Insurance full sponsored for both you and your family)
Team-building Support Bonus quarterly
100% official salary during the probation period, annual salary raise
Extra bonus per special occasions (Birthday, Labor Day, National Day, Solar New year, Lunar New Year)
Annual company outing trip/travel benefit
2. Working environment:
  5 working days/week with flexible working time and no overtime
Chance to go on business trip oversea
English working environment: You will have chance to practice English in both 4 skills.
Internal English Class full sponsored by Company
Professional, creative, comfortable and flexible working environment
Young and talented colleagues with nice and supportive leader
Chance to develop career with clear and motivated performance management system
Common cultural-sportive Clubs and activities, sponsored and/or supported by the Company
If you find an open culture where people are valued, trusted and treated fairly, let's join us!

listJob.description:
Report to : Cybersecurity Managers <Risk Advisory team>
About First Trust ACPA Vietnam
Founded in 2008, First Trust ACPA Vietnam Co., Ltd is a joint venture between First Trust International Group and ACPA Group. We are dedicated to adding value for our clients through a wide range of high-quality professional services, including bookkeeping, fund administration, tax, audit and risk advisory. At the heart of our mission is a commitment to creating a modern, professional working environment and unique corporate culture where our team members can collaborate, grow, and thrive together.
About the role: 
We are seeking the talented Associate Consultant, Cyber Adversarial Emulation to join our team.
As the Associate Consultant, Cyber Adversarial Emulation you will be responsible for providing client support by offering recommendations for addressing vulnerabilities and improving security measures. Additionally, the associate collaborates with clients to enhance their overall cybersecurity posture and ensure the protection of their systems.
Key responsibilities:
Perform vulnerability assessments, penetration testing and adversarial attack simulations on a wide range of technologies including but not limited to Network, Web, Mobile, Thick Client Applications, Cloud, API, and Operational Technology.
Work in a client-facing role to provide assistance in recommendations for remediation of reported vulnerabilities and security gaps.
listJob.jobExperience:
Requirements:
Degree in a computing-related, engineering, Math or Applied Math course
Strong communication and interpersonal skills
Good command of English
Strong interest in cybersecurity, particularly in the offensive security domain
Demonstrates strong problem-solving skills in approaching technical challenges
Demonstrates strong critical thinking skills in ambiguous and complex situations
Understanding of foundational cybersecurity and IT concepts
Preferred Qualities:
Familiarity with cyber security principles (e.g. networking, web development, vulnerability classes) and industry best practices (e.g. OWASP Top 10, MITRE ATT&CK Framework)
Familiar with programming/scripting languages such as .NET, Python, Bash and PowerShell, etc.
Possess relevant cybersecurity certifications or accredited experience from CTF and Bug Bounties
listJob.privilege:
Opportunities:

Enjoying a competitive remuneration package.
Young & vibrant working environment with great career development opportunities.
Annual trips, team bonding activities and other staff benefits.

listJob.description:
We are looking for a detail-oriented Junior Quality Control Specialist to join our team. This entry-level role is ideal for someone eager to develop their skills in quality assurance and contribute to ensuring our products meet high standards of reliability, performance, and compliance. You will work closely with senior team members and cross-functional teams to support quality control processes and enhance product quality.
 Responsibilities:
Assist in implementing quality control procedures to ensure compliance with industry standards and internal guidelines.
Conduct product testing and inspections to identify defects, inconsistencies, and areas for improvement.
Support the analysis of data and performance metrics to track product quality and suggest enhancements.
Work alongside development teams to understand quality requirements and best practices.
Help execute functional, regression, and performance testing to ensure product reliability.
Document and report findings, providing clear insights for improvements.
Assist in maintaining and optimizing workflows to enhance efficiency and compliance.
Troubleshoot basic quality issues and collaborate with the team to implement corrective actions.
Stay updated with quality assurance best practices and industry trends.
listJob.jobExperience:
1+ years of experience in quality control, software testing, or a related field.
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Quality Assurance, or a relevant discipline.
Solid understanding of quality assurance methodologies, testing strategies, and industry best practices.
Hands-on experience with manual testing techniques and familiarity with test automation tools and frameworks.
Ability to analyze and troubleshoot software issues, ensuring system reliability and efficiency.
Experience working with databases (e.g., SQL or MongoDB) and performing data integrity checks.
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to identify defects and contribute to corrective actions.
Effective communication and teamwork skills, collaborating with development, product, and QA teams.
A proactive approach to learning new tools, technologies, and testing environments.

listJob.location: 5th floor, 186 Dien Bien Phu Street, Vo Thi Sau Ward, Qu·∫≠n 3, TP H·ªì Ch√≠ Minh
listJob.description:
Are you looking for a workplace that values your skills, creativity, and passion‚Äîbut also knows how to have fun? Then look no further! 
 At Omnia, we are not just colleagues‚Äîwe‚Äôre a community. Our team of 60 talented professionals, spread across 5 countries, collaborates daily to build something extraordinary. We believe that great things happen when skilled people from diverse backgrounds come together in an environment that fosters both professional growth and social connections. Whether it‚Äôs working on exciting global projects, sharing knowledge across borders, or enjoying team outings, we make sure work is both rewarding and enjoyable.
 Why you‚Äôll love working with us? 
A culture that values expertise ‚Äì We appreciate skilled people who take pride in their craft. 
A vibrant, social workplace ‚Äì Team lunches or company trips, we love to celebrate together. 
Opportunities to grow ‚ÄìProfessional training or new challenges, we support your development. 
Work-life balance ‚Äì We believe happy employees do the best work! 
If you‚Äôre passionate about your field and looking for a company that truly values both skill and team spirit, we‚Äôd love to meet you. Join us and let‚Äôs build something great together! 
 Your Role: 
As a Test Automation Engineer, you will be responsible for driving the implementation and execution of test automation within our SaaS solution. Working closely with cross-functional teams, you will lead the creation, maintenance, and optimization of our test automation framework, ensuring measurable improvements in test efficiency and quality.  
 Key Responsibilities: 
Design, implement, and maintain a scalable, modular test automation framework. 
Focus on automating critical test scenarios for API, UI, and integration layers. 
Analyze manual test cases and prioritize automation candidates. 
Build and maintain stable test scripts to cover high-risk workflows. 
Integrate automated tests into CI/CD pipelines for continuous feedback. 
Conduct training sessions to ensure long-term sustainability of the automation framework. 
Regularly evaluate and improve the framework‚Äôs reliability and performance. 
Create and maintain documentation for the automation framework and processes. 
Share insights and propose improvements to ensure scalability and maintainability.
listJob.jobExperience:
Requirements: 
Experience: 
5+ years in software testing, including at least 3 years focused on test automation. 
Proven track record of leading test automation for complex SaaS web solutions. 
Technical Skills: 
Strong expertise in automation tools & frameworks like Cypress, Selenium, REST Assured, Postman, or similar. 
Hands-on experience with API testing and integrating test automation into CI/CD pipelines. 
Proficiency in programming languages such as C#, JavaScript or equivalent. 
Familiarity with version control systems (e.g., Git) for efficient collaboration. 
Soft Skills: 
Excellent problem-solving and analytical abilities. 
Strong English communication skills to work seamlessly with global teams. 
Ability to prioritize, manage tasks efficiently, and deliver results in a structured manner. 
Education: 
A Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
listJob.privilege:
When working at Omnia you will be part of talented and ambitious, highly skilled development teams in a professional and dynamic working environment. We offer: 
Join a high-impact, global SaaS company and shape the future of digital transformation.

listJob.name: Technical/Solution Architect (.NET, Next.js)
listJob.location: 5th Floor, 82 Tran Huy Lieu Street, Ward 15, Qu·∫≠n Ph√∫ Nhu·∫≠n, TP H·ªì Ch√≠ Minh
listJob.description:
Job Summary: 
We are seeking a highly experienced Solution Architect with 10+ years in software development and architecture. The ideal candidate has a strong background in .NET, Next.js, PHP and Microservices Architecture, along with hands-on expertise in AWS, Azure, and GCP. You will play a crucial role in designing and implementing high-scale systems such as CRM and E-commerce platforms, ensuring performance, scalability, and security.

We are looking for a candidate with strong experience working in IT outsourcing services and a background in consulting roles. The ideal candidate should have excellent communication skills, be confident in interacting with international clients, and collaborate effectively with teams.
In this role, you will have the opportunity to learn about various platforms and the company‚Äôs products while working on multiple projects. You will contribute to high-level consultancy services while still enjoying hands-on experience alongside our teams.
 Key Responsibilities: 
1. Solution Architecture & Design
Define and design scalable, high-performance architectures for CRM, E-commerce, and other high-scale systems.
Develop and enforce best practices in Microservices Architecture, Event-Driven Architecture, and API-first design.
Architect robust and scalable solutions using .NET Core, Next.js, Node.js, PHP and other modern technologies.
Apply Domain-Driven Design (DDD) and Clean Architecture principles to ensure maintainability and flexibility.
 2. Cloud & Infrastructure
Design and implement cloud-native architectures on AWS, Azure, and GCP, selecting the best cloud services for different workloads.
Define and optimize CI/CD pipelines, infrastructure-as-code (IaC) using Terraform, Pulumi, or CloudFormation.
Architect solutions for serverless computing, containerization (Docker, Kubernetes), and distributed systems.
Implement high-availability (HA) and disaster recovery (DR) strategies to ensure system reliability.
 3. Technical Leadership & Development
Provide technical guidance and mentorship to engineering teams, ensuring architectural best practices.
Conduct code reviews, evaluate technology stacks, and drive continuous improvement initiatives.
Collaborate with Product Managers, Engineering Teams, and Business Stakeholders to align technical solutions with business goals.
Evaluate emerging technologies and drive innovation in cloud computing, DevOps, and system scalability.
4. Security, Performance, & Monitoring
Define security best practices, ensuring compliance with industry standards (e.g., OWASP, ISO 27001, GDPR, PCI DSS).
Implement observability and monitoring solutions using tools like Prometheus, Grafana, ELK stack, or Datadog.
Optimize system performance, scalability, and cost-efficiency for millions of concurrent users.
listJob.jobExperience:
10+ years of experience in software development and architecture, with a focus on .NET, Next.js, and Microservices.
Expertise in designing high-scale distributed systems such as CRM, E-commerce, or FinTech applications.
Proven experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) and cloud-native services.
Hands-on experience with containerization (Docker, Kubernetes, Istio) and serverless computing.
Strong knowledge of Microservices, Event-Driven Architecture (Kafka, RabbitMQ, AWS SNS/SQS).
Expertise in SQL/NoSQL databases (e.g., PostgreSQL, MySQL, MongoDB, DynamoDB, Redis, CosmosDB).
Proficiency in API gateway management, GraphQL, REST, and gRPC.
Experience with DevOps, CI/CD pipelines, Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools like Terraform, Pulumi, or CloudFormation.
Deep understanding of DDD, Clean Architecture, SOLID principles, and design patterns.

listJob.location: Level 5 - 6, East Tower, Lumiere Riverside, 277 Vo Nguyen Giap, An Phu Ward, Thu Duc City, HCMC., Th√†nh ph·ªë Th·ªß ƒê·ª©c, TP H·ªì Ch√≠ Minh
listJob.description:
Description
Are you an experienced Solution Architect who is willing to deliver resilient solutions with enterprise integration patterns in business-complex and large-scaled systems for multiple years? If so read on.
About our Team:
Our team is responsible for creating a brand of new digital financial platforms and apps that are highly reliable and scalable using modern engineering practices. You will be joining a project which talented software engineers in our Digital Bank Build team who is responsible for designing, building, and maintaining the new digital banking platform and the customer channels. As part of the team, you will be responsible for implementing software features, involve in technical designs, and writing tests to ensure the high-quality delivery of the product. The teams operate in Scrum and DevOps models.
We‚Äôre looking for top engineers out there! During the interview process, we will test your coding and design skills to assess your experience and depth of knowledge. Don‚Äôt worry our interview process will be fun!
Responsibilities:
Analyze current technologies used within the company to define strategies and road-maps for improving cross-country digital architectures.
Identify technical gaps and advise proper solutions following standardized technologies and appropriate technology life cycles.
Influence business owners and stakeholders on an appropriate design considering technical complexity, risks, resources, scope, and time-bound.
Being technical liaison and evangelist to establish business relationships with all stakeholders for conducting product presentations and evaluations.
Observe the application of architectural compliance, company practices, and best practices to propose proper actions at the right time to mitigate risk and security issues.
Provide various levels of detailed specifications for different levels of stakeholders to be aligned on a common approach.
Follow up and support development teams to unblock technical issues, advise and influence team members, solution delivery managers, and product owners to follow good practices and appropriate architectural designs.
listJob.jobExperience:

Designing and delivering resilient solutions with enterprise integration patterns in business- complex and large-scale systems for multiple years
Strong experience in system resilience, analytics, monitoring, and notifications
Hands-on experience with Cloud (AWS is a big plus)
Strong experience in system resilience, analytics, monitoring, and notifications
Excellent understanding of application development across multiple geographies
Good at technical writing and documenting solutions by diagrams and figures
Experienced in different kinds of large-scale data stores and messaging systems
Experience in Fintech or Digital banking is a plus

Your qualifications:
At least 5 years of experience working as a software engineer
At least 3 years working as Solution Architect
Design one or more systems running on production
Technical leadership and communication skills
Excellent written and oral English

listJob.name: Agile Project Manager
listJob.location: 9-11 Dong Da street, Ward 2, Qu·∫≠n T√¢n B√¨nh, TP H·ªì Ch√≠ Minh
listJob.description:
Responsible for account delivery, our PDM staff manage and monitor KPIs, to ensure the successful delivery of solutions that meet objectives, timelines, and budgets. These multifunctional teams take care of everything from pre-sales, to monitoring progress, to reporting and mitigating risks.
 As an Agile Project Manager at Endava, you are responsible for successfully implementing and delivering projects using Agile methodologies. You'll also serve as a facilitator, communicator, and leader, fostering collaboration, efficiency and effective project execution. An Agile Project Manager plays crucial role in guiding the team, managing stakeholder expectations and driving the project toward its objectives.
 Responsibilities:
Reporting to the Delivery Partner, the Agile Project Managers will take responsibility for software delivery, support or maintenance projects, establishing, monitoring and controlling progress checkpoints and/or service level agreements.
Ensure that assigned resources (staff, equipment, and services, funds, time) are properly utilized and accounted for and up-to-date usage of information is maintained.
Establish the scope of the project and take full responsibility for the clear briefing and direction of staff using Agile methodologies.
Plan the work with a team or project group within an Agile framework using appropriate planning tools, producing plans to standards required.
Ensure the Agile disciplines are correctly followed and educate members of the team and the client that do not have the relevant experience.
Monitor progress, producing reports on progress against plan according to standards, acting within authority to maintain progress whilst recognizing areas requiring decision making in respect of budget, schedules, resources, working methods, staff matters and or technical difficulties.
Demonstrate leadership skills in team building and staff motivation and assist with the assessment, development and mentoring of staff.
Communicate effectively, both formally and informally, orally and in writing, on technical and non-technical issues with all those with whom working interfaces and iteration arise, whether colleagues, users or customers at all levels of seniority.
listJob.jobExperience:
More than 8 years of overall IT industry experience, including 5 years as a Project Management/ Scrum Master role.
Detailed knowledge of Agile methodologies including Scrum, with project experience applying this knowledge.
Scrum Master certification is preferable.
Experience in mentoring team members that have no previous agile experience.
Knowledge of how to introduce Agile methodologies into new environments.
Ability to enforce Scrum and other Agile principles and to explain the benefits to team members.
Technical understanding and ability to provide support and understanding to the consulting team.
Excellent English communication skills.
Excellent presentation skills and experience presenting to senior-level stakeholders.
Highly self-motivated and able to work in an adaptable and flexible environment.
An enthusiastic team player.
This role is also eligible for candidates who live in other provinces or cities that desire to relocate to HCMC.

listJob.description:
Global Fashion Group is the leading fashion and lifestyle destination in growth markets across LATAM, SEA and ANZ. From our people to our customers and partners, we exist to empower everyone to express their true selves through fashion. Our three e-commerce platforms: Dafiti, ZALORA and THE ICONIC connect an assortment of international, local and own brands to over 800 million consumers from diverse cultures and lifestyles. GFG‚Äôs platforms provide seamless and inspiring customer experiences from discovery to delivery, powered by art & science that is infused with unparalleled local knowledge. As part of the Group‚Äôs vision is to be the #1 online destination for fashion & lifestyle in growth markets, we are committed to doing this responsibly by being people and planet positive across everything we do.
 THE TEAM
The Data Team is an integral part of GFG and is essential to enable a data-driven decision making culture. The Data team sits at the cross-roads of various departments including: Strategic Brand Partnerships, Commercial,  Finance, Product Management, Technology and Platform Services. It is an exciting place to be and allows us to provide unique insights about the business, its environment and the marketplace. 
 ABOUT THE ROLE 
We are looking for Senior Data Scientist who is happy to play across the data spectrum - of data engineering, data science and eventually a bit of data translation of insights to English.
You should have a demonstrated passion for Data Science in coding, optimizing computational logic, applying data mining techniques, conducting statistical analysis, and building predictive models to enable data driven decision making for the wider business through the art of data empathy. This role will work on some cutting-edge data platforms and algorithms, with an unquenchable need to get things done!
You will be reporting to the Head of Data Science and working with various counterparts in Singapore, Vietnam, Germany, Malaysia and Vietnam.

THE IMPACT YOU‚ÄôLL MAKE
Your work will have a direct impact on shaping the future of how all the operations and decisions are enabled across 14 countries around the world, and will help run the group more efficiently and be on the leading edge of offering a seamless customer experience.

BS/MS/PhD in Computer Science or related technical discipline
5+ years of working experience in a similar role.
Demonstrable knowledge and application of data mining, statistical modeling and machine learning techniques 
Proficient in any of the following programming languages: Python, R, Scala
Experience with SQL and relational databases
Experience with AWS and GCP cloud technologies
Good writing and verbal English communication skills

Working at Laconic means being part of a company that is transforming how organizations and governments leverage data, technology, and geospatial intelligence to address global environmental challenges. Through AI-driven analytics, real-time monitoring, and advanced geospatial technology, we provide actionable insights that drive sustainability and climate resilience.
Our cutting-edge solutions help decision-makers analyze environmental risks, optimize resource management, and implement data-backed strategies to create lasting impact. By delivering predictive intelligence and innovative technologies, Laconic empowers industries, policymakers, and conservationists to make informed decisions that safeguard natural resources and drive meaningful change.
Join us in shaping a future where data and technology drive sustainability, ensuring a more resilient and thriving world.
We are looking for a candidate who will:
Lead the end-to-end architecture design of system software products.

Make key technical decisions, including the selection of technologies for the frontend, backend, middleware, frameworks, etc.

Mentor and guide other developers in the team.

listJob.name: Senior Software Engineer (.Net CORE)
listJob.location: Ho Chi Minh City, Qu·∫≠n 1, TP H·ªì Ch√≠ Minh
listJob.description:
Are you an experienced Full-Stack Software Engineer looking for a new challenge? Join our team as a Senior Full-Stack Software Engineer and play a key role in the development of innovative software solutions. You will be part of a Scrum team of developers and testers, collectively responsible for the entire software development lifecycle‚Äîfrom concept to deployment. Your expertise will ensure the quality, security, and performance of our applications, and you will also troubleshoot and resolve issues, possibly in production environments.
In this role, you will contribute to designing, developing, testing, building, automating deployment, and documenting functional and non-functional requirements for various software applications, libraries, APIs, and services. You will also ensure seamless integration with other applications. As a mentor, you will guide less experienced developers, lead knowledge transfer sessions, engage in pair and mob programming, and conduct code reviews. Your leadership will help the team adhere to best development practices, coding standards, and guidelines.
You will actively participate in Scrum ceremonies, including backlog refinement, sprint planning, stand-ups, and retrospectives. By championing Agile and DevOps practices such as eXtreme Programming, CI/CD, and BDD, you will help foster a culture of continuous improvement. Additionally, you will break down user and technical stories into prioritized tasks and provide clear implementation guidance to the team.
Staying ahead of industry trends and emerging technologies is crucial in this role. Your technical curiosity will drive innovation and improvement within the team. You will also maintain regular communication with the Team Manager, quickly acquire knowledge of our systems and processes, and build strong working relationships with both IT and non-IT stakeholders within the company.
If you are passionate about software development, eager to mentor others, and excited to work in an Agile environment, we would love to hear from you.
listJob.jobExperience:
To be successful in this role, you should have at least seven years of proven experience in positions such as Senior Software Developer or Senior Software Engineer. A Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field is preferred, but equivalent practical experience will also be considered. You should have extensive experience in backend development using C# and .NET, along with proficiency in JavaScript or TypeScript and UI frameworks like Angular, React, or Vue.js.
A strong understanding of data structures, algorithms, and object-oriented design principles is essential, as well as familiarity with key software architectural patterns such as Client-Server and Layered architectures. You should also have in-depth knowledge of relational database systems like SQL Server, PostgreSQL, or Oracle, along with experience in Clean Code principles and refactoring.
You should be well-versed in software testing frameworks, automated testing tools, and test-first approaches like Test-Driven Development (TDD) and Behavior-Driven Development (BDD). Familiarity with version control systems such as Git and collaboration tools like Azure DevOps or JIRA is also important. An analytical mindset, strong problem-solving skills, and attention to detail will help you excel in this role.
Excellent communication skills are essential, and you should be able to work collaboratively in a team environment. Fluency in English is required, with strong verbal and written communication skills, including technical writing. A conversational level of Vietnamese is also desirable to facilitate local communication. An Agile mindset and experience working in Agile or DevOps environments, using Scrum or Kanban methodologies, will be highly valuable. Additionally, strong organizational and leadership skills will enable you to work independently and effectively manage your responsibilities.
Preferred qualifications include experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud, as well as knowledge of DevOps practices, CI/CD pipelines, containerization with Docker or Kubernetes, and Infrastructure as Code (IaC). Previous experience as a Scrum Master, knowledge of system monitoring tools like Grafana, and expertise with Object-Relational Mapping (ORM) frameworks like Entity Framework would be advantageous. Advanced knowledge of HTML/CSS and basic UI principles, along with prior experience in Angular, would be beneficial. Familiarity with PowerShell scripting and NoSQL databases like MongoDB, Elasticsearch, or Redis is a plus. Additionally, conversational proficiency in Mandarin or French would be helpful for facilitating communication in a multilingual environment.

Our mission and vision:
Vision: Everything you need for travel & transportation
Over thousands of years, human history has made great leaps, mainly due to the application of technology. Believing in this, VeXeRe strongly desires to improve and upgrade people's lives through the ability to innovate and apply technology, meeting all needs in travel and transportation sectors.
Mission: Bring more happiness to your journey
Everyone has trips that can be the beginning of excited and happy journeys, changing each person's life. Therefore, the mission that VeXeRe strives for is not only limited to regular trips, but also the journey of life of each person. VeXeRe wishes to accompany and bring more happiness to each journey.
Happiness can be enhanced: It can be a cheaper trip that enable more people to travel, more access to better services, with more happy and more meaningful experiences.

A subsidiary of the FPT Group, FPT Software is known as a leading global information technology service provider headquartered in Vietnam. With over 33,000 employees working in 83 offices across 30 countries on five continents, FPT Software consistently delivers the best solutions to more than 1000 clients, including 100 Fortune 500 companies. The team
We are seeking a Senior Database Engineer to enhance our database systems with a focus on security, performance optimization, and cost efficiency.
In this role, you will be responsible for designing and implementing robust and scalable data solutions to support critical business operations. 
You will work closely with business stakeholders, data analysts, and software engineers to understand their data needs and translate them into effective and efficient data models.
Ensure database security by implementing best practices for access control, encryption, and data protection.
Optimize database performance, identifying bottlenecks and improving query execution.
Focus on cost optimization, balancing performance with infrastructure expenses, particularly in cloud environments

Strong experience with data warehousing and data lakehouse technologies AWS Redshift or Databricks.
Expertise in SQL and NoSQL databases.
Experience with data modeling techniques (e.g., dimensional modeling, star schema).
Experience with data integration tools and technologies (e.g., ETL/ELT tools, data pipelines).
Experience with cloud computing platforms AWS is a plus.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

listJob.name: Backend Engineering Manager (NodeJS/SA) Up to $3500
listJob.location: EVOL - TTC Building, No 1, Tan Thuan Street, District 7, HCMC, Qu·∫≠n 7, TP H·ªì Ch√≠ Minh
listJob.description:
A Backend Engineering Manager is responsible for setting the technical direction of backend systems, overseeing DevOps processes, and addressing security concerns related to these domains. This role includes guiding teams, ensuring system scalability, and maintaining a high-quality codebase
Responsibilities:
Lead and mentor a backend engineering team of approximately 20 engineers, fostering a culture of excellence, collaboration, and continuous professional growth.
Define and enforce technical direction, best practices, and standards for backend architecture, DevOps pipelines, and system security.
Design and implement scalable, high-availability backend architectures with a focus on optimal performance and reliability.
Oversee CI/CD pipelines and manage cloud infrastructure (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure) to ensure efficient and seamless deployments.
Implement and maintain robust security protocols for backend systems, ensuring compliance with industry standards and proactive threat monitoring.
Troubleshoot complex technical issues and provide innovative solutions to maintain system integrity.
Drive innovation by evaluating emerging technologies (e.g., Kafka, Redis) and integrating them into existing architectures to enhance performance and scalability.
Communicate project technical status, risks, and insights effectively to senior management and key stakeholders.
Take ownership and accountability for solution architecture decisions, ensuring alignment with business goals and technical feasibility.
Make critical decisions related to software architecture, with a deep focus on leveraging modern tech stacks and distributed system design principles.
listJob.jobExperience:
Requirements:
Must-Have:
Experience:
At least 7 years in Backend Engineering, including 5+ years in Leadership or Management roles.
Extensive hands-on experience in Backend development (NodeJS, Golang, Java, Rust‚Ä¶), DevOps, and Cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure).
Technical Expertise:
Strong knowledge of object-oriented programming, enterprise software architecture, and distributed systems.
Proven ability to design and manage CI/CD pipelines and containerized environments (Docker, Kubernetes).
Expertise in troubleshooting, optimizing, and scaling distributed systems to meet high-performance demands.
Soft Skills:
Exceptional analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills, with a proven ability to collaborate across teams and stakeholders.
Nice to Have:
Experience in designing and implementing PKI systems, particularly those involving key distribution mechanisms (e.g., MPC-SSS and MPC-TSS).
Proven track record in developing complex end-to-end decentralized applications (DApps).

listJob.name: Senior Backend Engineer - AGI (Python)
listJob.location: Havana Tower - 132 Ham Nghi, Qu·∫≠n 1, TP H·ªì Ch√≠ Minh
listJob.description:
We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Senior Developer to join our growing team, responsible for building and maintaining our calling platform. This platform is a mission-critical service that manages the routing of phone calls, schedules, and relays messages, and handles payment processing, making debt recovery more efficient.
As a Senior Developer, you will play a vital role in designing, developing, deploying, and maintaining high-quality, scalable, and resilient systems. You will collaborate with a team of talented engineers to build and improve upon our existing microservices architecture, driving innovation and efficiency within our platform. Our current stack is heavily Python-based, utilizing frameworks like FastAPI and tools such as SQLAlchemy, Redis, Celery, and more. We are committed to expanding our technological horizons and are planning to incorporate more languages, particularly Golang, into our ecosystem to leverage its strengths in performance and concurrency, aligning with the practices of other teams within the company. In addition to backend services, we are also seeking engineers who can contribute to building dynamic and responsive user interfaces using modern front-end techniques.
listJob.jobExperience:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field, or equivalent experience.
5+ years of professional experience in software development, with a proven track record of building and deploying production-ready applications.
Strong proficiency in Python and its associated ecosystem.
Experience with relational databases (e.g., PostgreSQL) and NoSQL databases (e.g., Redis).
Solid understanding of software engineering principles, design patterns, and best practices.
Experience building and consuming RESTful APIs.
Familiarity with containerization (Docker) and orchestration (e.g., Kubernetes).
Experience with version control systems (e.g., Git).
Excellent problem-solving, analytical, and communication skills.
A passion for learning new technologies and a desire to contribute to a dynamic and evolving team.
Domain Expertise (You‚Äôre likely to be using one or more of these concepts described here for your day-to-day)
Proven experience in optimizing database performance, including query optimization, indexing strategies, and schema design.

listJob.name: Senior Automation QC Engineer
listJob.location: 59 Nguyen Co Thach Street, An Loi Dong Ward, District 2 , Th√†nh ph·ªë Th·ªß ƒê·ª©c, TP H·ªì Ch√≠ Minh
listJob.description:
Join HerondLabs, a fast-growing Vietnamese startup at the forefront of crypto innovation and disruptive technology. Fresh off the successful global launch of our multi-platform web browser (used by millions worldwide) and supporting a venture capital fund managing multi-million-dollar investments in cutting-edge tech, we‚Äôre expanding our team to accelerate our mission. As a Senior QC Automation Engineer, you‚Äôll ensure the reliability and scalability of our flagship browser and crypto/web3 applications while shaping quality standards for high-impact projects backed by our VC arm. If you‚Äôre passionate about blockchain, bleeding-edge tech, and solving complex challenges in a dynamic startup environment, this is your opportunity to leave a mark on the future of decentralized innovation.
Responsibilities
Design, develop, and maintain automated/manual test plans, test scripts, and test cases for cross-platform browsers (Windows, macOS, iOS, Android), web3/crypto applications (wallets, dApps), and traditional web applications.
Build and maintain automation frameworks from scratch, ensuring compatibility with evolving libraries and release cycles.
Configure test environments, test data, and CI/CD pipelines as needed.
Execute tests, analyze results, and document defects.
Perform regression testing post-bug resolution.
Update scripts and frameworks to align with new releases and system upgrades.
Partner with developers, QA, analysts, and product owners to identify testing needs and shift testing left in the development lifecycle.
Liaise with internal teams (e.g., developers, PMs) to clarify system requirements and priorities.
Estimate efforts and plan testing schedules to meet project deadlines.
Prioritize tasks and coordinate testing activities across deliverables.
Stay updated on emerging testing tools/strategies; optimize framework design and tool selection.
Work with clients to enhance delivery capabilities and operational maturity.
Manage multiple tasks efficiently to meet business goals and client expectations.
listJob.jobExperience:
Skills and experience
Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.
3+ years of experience in software quality assurance, with expertise in automation frameworks (UI/E2E tools like Cypress/Playwright), API testing, and mobile/web app testing.
Build and maintain automation frameworks for web, mobile, and API testing.
Integrate automated tests into CI/CD pipelines (Jenkins, GitHub Actions) for Agile workflows.
Proficient in QA methodologies, test planning, and writing clear test cases.
Hands-on experience with white/black box testing and tools.
Coding skills in JavaScript/TypeScript, C# or Python.
Work in Agile/Scrum teams; clarify requirements with developers and product owners.
Strong communication skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams and regional stakeholders.
Problem-Solving: Logical, analytical, and detail-oriented with a passion for bug-free products.
Startup Attitude: Own tasks fully, thrive in ambiguity, and adapt to new challenges.
Time Management: Prioritize tasks, multitask under pressure, and learn new technologies proactively.
English proficiency for regional collaboration.
Preferred Qualifications
Experience with Chromium-based browser development or extension testing.
Knowledge of performance testing (JMeter, k6) or security testing (OWASP ZAP).
Familiarity with containerization (Docker) and cloud platforms (AWS, Azure).
ISTQB Certification or similar credentials.

listJob.name: Senior DevOps Engineer
listJob.location: 59 Nguyen Co Thach Street, An Loi Dong Ward, District 2 , Th√†nh ph·ªë Th·ªß ƒê·ª©c, TP H·ªì Ch√≠ Minh
listJob.description:
What we're looking for:
Join Herond Labs, a fast-growing Vietnamese startup at the forefront of crypto innovation and disruptive technology. Fresh off the successful global launch of our multi-platform web browser (used by millions worldwide) and supporting a venture capital fund managing multi-million-dollar investments in cutting-edge tech, we‚Äôre expanding our team to accelerate our mission. We are seeking a seasoned Senior DevOps Engineer with deep expertise in AWS and Azure to design, implement, and optimize cloud infrastructure and CI/CD pipelines. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record in managing scalable, secure, and cost-efficient cloud environments, with a strong focus on cloud cost optimization as a critical responsibility.

Role and responsibilities: 
Operate in a biweekly Agile sprint environment, engaging in daily stand-ups, sprint planning, retrospectives, demos, and other Scrum rituals to drive iterative development and team collaboration.
Deploy, manage, and monitor cloud infrastructure on AWS and Azure, ensuring high availability, scalability, and security.
Monitor, analyze and optimize cloud resources for cost-efficiency by analyzing usage patterns, rightsizing instances, and leveraging reserved capacity or spot instances.
Implement governance policies for cloud spending and resource allocation.
Automate provisioning, scaling, and decommissioning of resources to minimize waste and reduce costs.
Design and implement cost-saving strategies, including budget alerts, tagging policies, and automated shutdowns for non-production environments.
Partner with finance and engineering teams to forecast cloud spending and align with organizational goals.
Implement monitoring solutions using LGTM stack to track performance, uptime, and cost metrics.
Build and maintain CI/CD pipelines to automate software delivery, ensuring seamless integration, testing, and deployment across environments.
Set up alerts for cost overruns, performance bottlenecks, and security incidents.
Enforce security best practices (IAM, network policies, encryption) across AWS and Azure.
Document processes, tools, workflows and all optimization strategies in a centralized knowledge base.
Mentor and train new team members, equipping them with the skills and knowledge to excel in DevOps practices and tools.
listJob.jobExperience:
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.
4+ years in DevOps/SRE roles with hands-on expertise in deploying and managing AWS/Azure infrastructure using IaC tools (Terraform, Terragrunt, Ansible, ..) and monitoring/security tools.
3+ years of CI/CD pipeline experience (Jenkins, GitHub CI/CD) for multi-environment deployments and artifact repositories.
Proficiency in Scrum ceremonies, collaboration tools (Jira, Confluence), and strong communication skills for iterative development.
Strong background in cloud cost management (budgeting, forecasting, optimization).
Experience designing cloud governance frameworks (tagging, quotas) with AWS
Organizations, Azure Policy, and compliance knowledge (GDPR, HIPAA).
Advanced scripting skills (Python, Bash) for automating provisioning, scaling, and decommissioning with CI/CD-driven workflows.
Expertise in cost-saving strategies like budget alerts, automated tagging, automated shutdowns, ..
Proficiency in LGTM stack for monitoring, dashboards, alerts, and integrating with CI/CD pipelines.
Experience setting up alerting systems for cost overruns, performance bottlenecks, and anomaly detection.
Deep understanding of cloud security and compliance frameworks with vulnerability scanning tools.
Strong technical writing skills for documenting processes, tools, and workflows using tools like Confluence, Notion, or GitHub Wiki.
Proven mentoring experience, designing training programs, and fostering a collaborative, learning-focused culture for new team members.
 Preferred Qualifications:
Certifications: AWS Certified DevOps Engineer, Azure DevOps Engineer, or FinOps Certified Practitioner.

About us
A subsidiary of the FPT Group, FPT Software is known as a leading global information technology service provider headquartered in Vietnam. With over 30,000 employees working in 83 offices across 30 countries on five continents, FPT Software consistently delivers the best solutions to more than 1000 clients, including 100 Fortune 500 companies. Placing human resources as the cornerstone of its achievements, employee experience is our top priority in continually creating an innovative, open, and enjoyable work environment for every member.
 In 2023, FPT Software officially made its mark on the global billion-dollar company list. This is evidence of the talent and efforts of multiple generations of employees at FPT Software.
Why not explore your potential and embark on a brilliant journey with us?
 Responsibilities
‚Ä¢ Oversee the entire project/product development process ‚Äì from start to delivery.
‚Ä¢ Participate in workshops, meetings, discussions.

listJob.name: Senior Product Analyst (Data Scientist)
listJob.location: CMC Creative Space, Qu·∫≠n 7, TP H·ªì Ch√≠ Minh
listJob.description:
About Grab and Our Workplace
Grab is Southeast Asia's leading superapp. From getting your favourite meals delivered to helping you manage your finances and getting around town hassle-free, we've got your back with everything. In Grab, purpose gives us joy and habits build excellence, while harnessing the power of Technology and AI to deliver the mission of driving Southeast Asia forward by economically empowering everyone, with heart, hunger, honour, and humility.
 Get to Know the Team
The Grab Support team supports Grab's Partners, including drivers, passengers, and merchants, in using our products. The team is responsible for delivering exceptional customer service for our drivers, passengers, and merchant partners. As a Senior Product Analyst, you'll have the opportunity to collaborate with experts in technology, analytics, and business operations to drive the vision and growth of our platform.
 Get to Know the Role
We are looking for a Senior Product Analyst with great analytical skills to help product teams be more data-driven and objective and guide the design of controlled experiments. You will work closely with different teams within a business line (Product, Business, Engineering, Design and Data Science) to understand data requirements, identify key metrics, and provide data-driven insights. You will also work with stakeholders to evaluate the feasibility of new business/product ideas and provide appropriate recommendations. You will report to the Product Analytics Manager, and work onsite at the Grab HCMC office.
 The Critical Tasks You Will Perform
You will dive into data to align with business objectives, recommending novel solutions to address key customer challenges.
You will measure and analyze performance across markets and business lines using data.
You will develop analytical frameworks for identifying common patterns in recurring hypotheses and problems.
You will create models that examine product configurations and explore interaction effects.
You will monitor metrics, perform root cause analysis on metric shifts, and report findings.
You will design and implement experiments to guide product decisions, including A/B testing, analysis, and recommendations.
listJob.jobExperience:
Qualifications
What Essential Skills You Will Need
At least 4 years of experience in Analytics, Business Intelligence, or Data Science roles within large-scale Internet or E-Commerce sectors.
Expertise in designing, executing, and analyzing A/B tests and product experiments, including a solid understanding of hypothesis testing and design of experiments.
Highly proficient in both verbal & written English
Advanced SQL capabilities for querying large databases.
Skill in translating data into actionable insights for non-technical audiences using presentations and visualizations.
Proficiency in handling multiple projects and addressing ambiguous problems.
Hands-on experience with data analysis tools such as R or Python and visualization tools like Tableau, PowerBI, or D3.js.
listJob.privilege:
Life at Grab
We care about your well-being at Grab, here are some of the global benefits we offer:
We have your back with Term Life Insurance and comprehensive Medical Insurance.
With GrabFlex, create a benefits package that suits your needs and aspirations.
Celebrate moments that matter in life with loved ones through Parental and Birthday leave, and give back to your communities through Love-all-Serve-all (LASA) volunteering leave
We have a confidential Grabber Assistance Programme to guide and uplift you and your loved ones through life's challenges.
Balancing personal commitments and life's demands is made easier with our FlexWork arrangements such as differentiated hours
What We Stand For at Grab
We are committed to building an inclusive and equitable workplace that enables diverse Grabbers to grow and perform at their best. As an equal opportunity employer, we consider all candidates fairly and equally regardless of nationality, ethnicity, religion, age, gender identity, sexual orientation, family commitments, physical and mental impairments or disabilities, and other attributes that make them unique.

listJob.name: Senior Security Engineer
listJob.location: 29A Nguyen Dinh Chieu, Qu·∫≠n 1, TP H·ªì Ch√≠ Minh
listJob.description:
Role Summary
In this role, you will make significant contributions to building secure and modern cloud solutions. You will be part of a team responsible for designing and implementing security measures to protect cloud environments, assessing potential vulnerabilities, and ensuring compliance with security standards.
 Key Responsibilities
Perform cloud security assessments and implement security best practices based on standards like ISO 27001, CIS, and ICS controls.
Design and implement security measures for cloud environments, including AWS Inspector, AWS GuardDuty, Security Hub, VPC, WAF, and Trusted Advisor.
Utilize Infrastructure as Code (IaC) technologies to automate security infrastructure deployment.
Manage application security, following OWASP 10 and SANS 25 guidelines, and perform SAST, DAST, and SCA.
Conduct threat modeling, vulnerability management, and penetration testing for cloud infrastructure and applications.
Implement data governance processes, encryption mechanisms, and ID & Access Management (IAM).
Develop processes for incident and change management, business continuity planning, and capacity management.
Monitor and analyze logs for security insights and ensure compliance with DLP processes.
Collaborate with DevOps/DevSecOps teams to enhance security automation and adopt secure coding practices.
listJob.jobExperience:
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Information Systems, Information Technology, Computer Science, or similar.
5-7 years of experience in cloud security engineering.
Strong knowledge of cloud architecture, cloud services, and security frameworks.
Proficiency in Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools like Terraform and cloud platforms like AWS.
Experience in application security, vulnerability management, and penetration testing.
Familiarity with log monitoring services and incident management processes.
Recommended certifications: CCSK, CCAK, CCSP, AWS Security Specialty.

listJob.name: Senior Automation QA Engineer
listJob.location: Ho Chi Minh City, Qu·∫≠n 1, TP H·ªì Ch√≠ Minh
listJob.description:
Company Description
Eurofins Scientific is an international life sciences company, providing a unique range of analytical testing services to clients across multiple industries, to make life and our environment safer, healthier, and more sustainable. From the food you eat, to the water you drink, to the medicines you rely on, Eurofins laboratories work with the biggest companies in the world to ensure the products they supply are safe, their ingredients are authentic, and labelling is accurate. Eurofins is dedicated to delivering testing services that contribute to the health and safety of society and the planet, and to its corporate responsibility to protect the environment and ensure diversity, equity, and inclusion across the entire network of Eurofins companies.
Job Description
As an Automation Test Engineer, you will be responsible for ensuring the quality and reliability of enterprise applications through automation testing. Your role will involve developing and maintaining automated test scripts, integrating with test management tools, and conducting thorough reviews of test cases. You will work closely with other team members to identify and resolve defects, performing root cause analysis and improving defect management processes. Your focus will be on large-scale applications that include various front-end technologies such as WPF, web-based interfaces, and backend components, including databases, web services, and messaging systems.
In this position, you will apply your expertise in C# and object-oriented programming to build and optimise automation frameworks. You will be involved in testing web services and REST APIs, utilising tools like Selenium, XUnit, and Postman. Additionally, you will work with service testing tools such as Fiddler, SOAP UI, and JSON Lint to ensure comprehensive test coverage. Your role will require close collaboration within an Agile development environment, contributing to the overall quality of software releases and improving automation strategies over time.
listJob.jobExperience:
To succeed in this role, you should have 7 years of experience in automation testing with strong coding skills in C#. A solid understanding of software quality assurance methodologies and experience with test automation for enterprise applications is essential. You should be proficient in testing web services and REST APIs, as well as working with automation frameworks like Coded UI, Selenium, and XUnit. Hands-on experience with database queries and SOA testing principles will be beneficial.
Your ability to work in an Agile development environment, communicate effectively, and collaborate with international teams will be crucial. You should have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, along with the ability to quickly adapt to complex systems. Prior exposure to performance and load testing, as well as experience in large system integration projects, will be an advantage. A degree in Computer Science, MCA, or an equivalent qualification is required. The ideal candidate will be detail-oriented, proactive, and capable of handling multiple tasks while maintaining high quality standards.
listJob.privilege:
‚Ä¢              Join a dynamic and fast-growing global company, tackle great challenges with large-scale products, and work with modern technologies
‚Ä¢              We support your development and are committed to growing your career
‚Ä¢              Hybrid and flexible working environment with attractive benefits
‚Ä¢              We embrace diversity! As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we value strength in diversity and prohibit discrimination in any form.
‚Ä¢              English-speaking environment where you will have opportunities to work on global projects and connect with talented colleagues from around the world
‚Ä¢              Hybrid working model and good work-life balance
‚Ä¢              13th-month salary bonus and annual performance bonus
‚Ä¢              100% offered salary and mandatory social insurances in 2-month probation
‚Ä¢              15+ days of paid leave per year
‚Ä¢              Premium health insurance for employee
‚Ä¢              Annual company trip and various team building activities, appreciation gifts and care

listJob.name: Threat Intelligence Analyst (Python, Security)
listJob.location: Ho Chi Minh City, Qu·∫≠n 1, TP H·ªì Ch√≠ Minh
listJob.description:
Company Description
Eurofins Scientific is an international life sciences company, providing a unique range of analytical testing services to clients across multiple industries, to make life and our environment safer, healthier, and more sustainable. From the food you eat, to the water you drink, to the medicines you rely on, Eurofins laboratories work with the biggest companies in the world to ensure the products they supply are safe, their ingredients are authentic, and labelling is accurate. Eurofins is dedicated to delivering testing services that contribute to the health and safety of society and the planet, and to its corporate responsibility to protect the environment and ensure diversity, equity, and inclusion across the entire network of Eurofins companies.
Job Description
As a Threat Intelligence Analyst, you will join the Security Intelligence team, where your role will focus on assessing and mitigating threats to the organization. You will be responsible for identifying and analyzing targeted campaigns and threat actors, monitoring intrusion activities, and translating these threats to actionable intelligence. By leveraging data gathered through incident response and threat surface analysis, you will contribute to strengthening Eurofins‚Äô overall security posture.
In this role, you will proactively track emerging cyber threats, trends, and adversary activities across multiple regions using raw intelligence and data. Your tasks will include analyzing information from various sources such as OSINT, dark web monitoring, and proprietary threat feeds. You will develop intelligence reports, address intelligence gaps, and collaborate with cross-functional teams, including incident response, threat hunting, vulnerability management, and security operations. Furthermore, you will enhance threat intelligence tools, such as MISP and SOAR playbooks, while contributing to technical analysis of threat actor tools and tradecraft.
listJob.jobExperience:
To excel in this position, you should hold a degree such as BE, B.Tech, MCA, or an equivalent qualification, with at least four years of experience in a security or threat intelligence role and five years in cybersecurity. Familiarity with Threat Intelligence Platforms, malware analysis, and the MITRE ATT&CK framework is essential. Proficiency in Python, Bash scripts, or PowerShell, along with experience configuring tools like MISP, is advantageous.
Your role will require excellent verbal and written communication skills, analytical abilities, and a detail-oriented approach to problem-solving. You should be eager to continuously develop your personal and technical skills and possess a proactive mindset to adapt to changing priorities. The ability to work collaboratively with global teams and a solid understanding of threat actor tactics and tools will further contribute to your success in this position

listJob.description:
Company Description
Eurofins Scientific is an international life sciences company, providing a unique range of analytical testing services to clients across multiple industries, to make life and our environment safer, healthier, and more sustainable. From the food you eat, to the water you drink, to the medicines you rely on, Eurofins laboratories work with the biggest companies in the world to ensure the products they supply are safe, their ingredients are authentic, and labelling is accurate. Eurofins is dedicated to delivering testing services that contribute to the health and safety of society and the planet, and to its corporate responsibility to protect the environment and ensure diversity, equity, and inclusion across the entire network of Eurofins companies.
Job Description
As a Software Developer, you will play a key role in designing, building, and maintaining software solutions using the Microsoft Stack of Technologies. Your daily tasks will involve end-to-end software development, where you will use your proficiency in C#, .NET, WPF/XAML, Web APIs, LINQ, and Entity Framework. You will also utilise your skills to write and optimise SQL queries, ensuring performance and scalability. You will be part of a team that builds service-oriented or microservices-based applications, following industry best practices for object-oriented programming and design. Your work will require you to ensure high quality code, write unit-tested code, and apply effective debugging skills to resolve any issues across different environments.
In this role, you will have the opportunity to contribute to a team that values collaboration and continuous improvement. While working in an Agile environment, you will participate in Scrum or Kanban methodologies to deliver solutions efficiently. You may also be involved in test-driven or acceptance test-driven development to ensure that the software meets business requirements. Your work could extend to creating applications on Microsoft Azure and using tools such as FitNesse or Postman.
listJob.jobExperience:
To be successful in this role, you should have a degree in Computer Science, such as B.E./B.Tech. or MCA, or equivalent experience. You need to bring 6 years of professional experience in software development and a strong understanding of object-oriented programming principles, UML, and software development practices. Your ability to ensure performance management and troubleshoot C# or SQL-related performance issues is essential.
It would be beneficial if you have experience in WPF development, working in Agile team environments, and using methodologies such as Scrum or Kanban. Familiarity with test-driven development and cloud platforms like Microsoft Azure would also be advantageous.
In addition to your technical expertise, you should have excellent analytical and problem-solving skills and strong communication abilities, both written and verbal. Being self-motivated, detail-oriented, and able to work effectively both independently and as part of a team will be key to your success in this position.

Experience leading teams of QAE on a variety of interrelated applications (webs and mobiles) deployed on various technologies such as Web Application, Android, iOS.

listJob.name: Kafka Specialist (AWS MSK)
listJob.location: Level 5 - 6, East Tower, Lumiere Riverside, 277 Vo Nguyen Giap, An Phu Ward, Thu Duc City, HCMC., Th√†nh ph·ªë Th·ªß ƒê·ª©c, TP H·ªì Ch√≠ Minh
listJob.description:
We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Kafka Specialist with expertise in AWS Managed Streaming for Apache Kafka (MSK) to join our engineering team. In this role, you will be responsible for designing, implementing, and managing our event-driven architectures and real-time streaming solutions using AWS MSK. Your work will be pivotal in enabling our systems to process large-scale data streams efficiently, ensuring high availability, scalability, and reliability.
 Your Responsibilities:
AWS MSK Management:
Design, implement, and maintain streaming solutions using AWS Managed Streaming for Apache Kafka (MSK)
Monitor and manage Kafka clusters to ensure optimal performance, scalability, and uptime.
Configure and fine-tune MSK clusters, including partitioning strategies, replication, and retention policies.
Event-Driven Architecture:
Collaborate with our engineering teams to design and implement event-driven systems and microservices architectures.
Develop and maintain robust data pipelines to process and stream data in real-time using Kafka.
Ensure seamless integration between MSK/SQS/SNS and other AWS services such as Lambda, EventBridge Pipes, S3.
Performance Optimization:
Analyze and optimize the performance of Kafka clusters and streaming pipelines to meet high-throughput and low-latency requirements.
Implement best practices for Kafka topic design, consumer group management, and message serialization (e.g., Avro).
Security and Compliance:
Implement security best practices for MSK, including encryption, authentication, and access controls.
Ensure compliance with industry standards and regulations related to data streaming and event processing.
Monitoring and Troubleshooting:
Set up comprehensive monitoring and alerting for Kafka clusters and streaming applications using AWS CloudWatch and Datadog.
Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to data loss, message lag, and streaming failures.
Data Integration and ETL:
Design and implement data integration solutions to stream data between various sources and targets using MSK.
Lead data transformation and enrichment processes to ensure data quality and consistency in streaming applications
listJob.jobExperience:
Must have skills:
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
Minimum of 5 years of experience in event-driven architectures and streaming solutions.
Proven experience with Apache Kafka, with at least 2 years specifically in AWS MSK.
Experience in designing and implementing high-throughput, low-latency streaming applications in AWS environments.
Strong understanding of Kafka internals, including partitions, brokers, consumer groups, and message serialization formats.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Java, Python, or Scala for building streaming applications.
Experience with AWS services like Lambda, Kinesis, S3, and IAM in conjunction with MSK.
Familiarity with CI/CD tools and practices, as well as IaC tools like CloudFormation, Terraform, or CDK.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a proactive approach to identifying and resolving issues.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively across teams.
Nice to have skills
AWS Certified Solutions Architect, AWS Certified Developer, or similar AWS certification
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a proactive approach to identifying and resolving issues.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively across teams.
Ability to manage multiple priorities and projects in a fast-paced environment.

listJob.name: Data Scientist (Team Lead, Python)
listJob.location: 197 Tran Phu, Ward 4, Qu·∫≠n 5, TP H·ªì Ch√≠ Minh
listJob.description:
Vietmap JSC specializes in providing advanced mapping solutions powered by data science, AI, and machine learning. Our mission is to develop geospatial intelligence that enhances navigation, location analytics, and real-time mapping applications. We are looking for a Data Scientist ‚Äì Team Lead to manage our data science team and drive innovation in our MAP Custom Solution projects.
 Job Overview:
As a Data Scientist ‚Äì Team Lead, you will oversee the development of data-driven geospatial solutions, manage a team of data analysts and ML engineers, and collaborate with developers and GIS specialists. You will be responsible for designing predictive models, optimizing spatial data processing, and ensuring high-quality analytics for mapping applications.
 Key Responsibilities:
1. Lead and Manage the Data Science Team
Oversee and mentor a team of data scientists, data engineers, and machine learning engineers.
Set priorities, delegate tasks, and ensure alignment with project goals.
Provide technical guidance and professional development for team members.
2. Develop Advanced Geospatial Data Models
Design and implement predictive models for mapping, traffic analysis, and route optimization.
Work on geospatial machine learning, spatial-temporal data analysis, and clustering techniques.
Develop algorithms for spatial pattern recognition, land-use classification, and geospatial anomaly detection.
3. Optimize Data Processing and Analytics
Work with large-scale geospatial datasets, satellite imagery, GPS, and LiDAR data.
Implement data cleaning, transformation, and feature engineering for spatial datasets.
Ensure efficient data storage and retrieval using cloud services and databases (PostGIS, BigQuery, AWS, Azure).
4. Collaborate with Cross-Functional Teams
Work with GIS specialists, developers, and business analysts to integrate data science solutions into mapping applications.
Align data science initiatives with business objectives and client needs.
Provide data-driven insights and recommendations for decision-making.
5. Manage Data Science Projects and Performance Metrics
Define project scope, objectives, and timelines for data-driven mapping solutions.
Monitor KPIs such as model accuracy, processing speed, and data integrity.
Continuously refine algorithms and models to enhance performance.
6. Stay Updated on Data Science and Geospatial Innovations
Research and apply cutting-edge AI, machine learning, and big data technologies in the geospatial field.
Stay current with trends in deep learning, satellite analytics, and real-time spatial processing.
listJob.jobExperience:
Qualifications:
Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
5+ years of experience in data science, including leadership experience managing teams.
Strong programming skills in Python or R, with expertise in data libraries (Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow).
Experience with GIS and spatial data processing tools (QGIS, PostGIS, ArcGIS).
Proficiency in cloud computing and big data technologies (AWS, GCP, Azure, Spark).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with experience in geospatial machine learning models.
Excellent communication skills to coordinate with technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Preferred Skills:
Experience in satellite imagery analysis and remote sensing.
Understanding of deep learning models for geospatial applications.
Familiarity with real-time geospatial data streaming.

listJob.description:
Analyze, design, create, and execute C# automated test cases for back end microservices.
Create‚ÄØfunctional testing in automated tests, including unit testing, API testing, integration testing, end-to-end testing,‚ÄØregression tests, etc.
Perform manual testing if proper‚ÄØand carry out non-functional testing.
Collaborate with developers, BAs, and scrum teams to ensure thorough understanding and coverage of testing requirements.
Identify, log, and track defects, working closely with developers and team to resolve issues.
Code review and educate developers to create good automated tests.
Collaborate closely as part of the development team by providing a client viewpoint.
Actively participate in sprint planning and other Agile ceremonies, providing insights into quality and testing progress.
Research new technologies available and its proper application; make suggestions/contributions for the improvement of software testing/quality/delivery.
listJob.jobExperience:
Must have:
Strong experience in Cypress, Playwright, or Selenium.
Solid experience‚ÄØwith API testing, unit testing, and integration testing.
Experience with SQL databases and be able to write SQL script.
Good understanding‚ÄØof the software development lifecycle (SDLC) especially in Agile environments.
Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a team.
A confident and dynamic attitude with a proactive approach to problem-solving.
A willingness to learn and adopt new automation technologies is a significant advantage.
Nice to have:
Can understand C# code and discuss with developers the issues in C# code.
Experience with understanding complicated software systems, microservice architecture.
Experience with event driven architecture ‚Äì Kafka, service bus etc.
Experience with Non-functional testing such as Performance testing, Resilience testing, Security testing.
Experience with APM tools such as Datadog.
Experience with CI/CD, Azure DevOps.
Experience with code commit and code review.
Soft skills:  
Effective verbal English skills in video conferences and face-to-face communication.
Know how to manage tasks and perform context switching
Have a resilience mindset, handle stress well.
Proactive and self-learning mentality.

listJob.description:
About the Role/position
As a Senior .NET Developer, you will be involved in all aspects of the software development cycle from conception to deployment.
You will work closely with other developers, business analysts, and technical leads to understand requirements and provide technical solutions. 
In addition, you will be responsible for mentoring junior developers and providing guidance on best practices.
listJob.jobExperience:
Responsibilities:
Design, develop, and maintain scalable and efficient software applications using .NET framework.
Collaborate with business stakeholders and technical teams to gather requirements and define the scope.
Participate in the full software development lifecycle, including requirements analysis, design, coding, testing, and deployment.
Implement clean, maintainable, and reusable code following best practices and coding standards.
Technical Requirements / Qualifications
Must have:
Good knowledge of OOP.
More than 03 years of experience working with C# .NET and .NET Core
net6 and above
Entity Framework (DatabaseFirst, CodeFirst)
Web API (MVC, OAuth, ‚Ä¶)
.NET design patterns (Repository, dependency injection, resilient pattern ‚Ä¶)
Knowledge of N-tier, Microservices architectures, database design, dependency injection, TDD, BDD, xUnit, SpecFlow.
Knowledge of cloud technologies e.g., Azure, AWS...
Work well in Agile Software Development using Scrum framework.
Understand and follow DevOps: CI/CD.
Good at GIT source code management.
Language:
English (mandatory)
French (preferred)
Nice to have:
ReactJS skills
Understand and follow Clean Architecture.
Knowledge of container docker, resilience pattern 
Soft skills:
Be a problem solver with great problem-solving skills.
Proactive and effective self-learning skills and research.
