As an AI Engineer at De Heus Animal Nutrition, you will play a critical role in designing, developing, and implementing advanced AI and machine learning solutions to enhance our data analytics capabilities. You will work closely with various stakeholders, including Data Engineers, Data Visualization Specialists, Data and Digital Business Partners, and business key stakeholders, to ensure that AI solutions align with business needs and objectives. You will report directly to the Data Solution Architect Lead and collaborate closely with the Solution Architect to integrate AI models into our Azure-based data platform.
B. ACCOUNTABILITIES:
1. Develop and Deploy AI Models
Build, train, and deploy machine learning models and AI algorithms for applications such as predictive analytics, recommendation systems, and automated decision-making processes.
2. Collaborate with Cross-Functional Teams
Work closely with the Solution Architect, Data Engineers, Data Visualization Specialists, Data and Digital Business Partners, and business stakeholders to gather requirements and design suitable AI solutions.
3. Data Integration and Processing
Collaborate with Data Engineers to integrate data from various systems into the Azure platform, using tools like Azure Data Factory and Azure Databricks.
4. Optimize Performance and Monitor Models
Optimize AI models to improve performance, scalability, and accuracy; monitor and maintain models in production environments.
5. Research and Innovation
Keep up with the latest advancements in AI, machine learning, and cloud technologies; evaluate new tools and methods that could enhance data analytics capabilities.
6. Documentation and Knowledge Sharing
Create and maintain detailed documentation for AI models, algorithms, and processes; organize training sessions and knowledge-sharing activities with relevant teams.
C. RESULTS:
- High-accuracy AI models successfully deployed into production environments, meeting or exceeding performance and reliability standards.
- AI solutions developed align with business requirements and seamlessly integrate with existing data processes.
- Data successfully prepared and integrated to support AI model training and deployment, ensuring data quality and availability.
- AI models perform efficiently and stably, with quick response times and optimized operational costs.
- Propose and implement new technologies and methodologies that enhance the performance and value of AI solutions within the company.
- Comprehensive and easy-to-understand documentation supports collaboration and maintenance; enhanced understanding and adoption of AI across the organization.
listJob.jobExperience:
QUALIFICATIONS:
- Bachelor‚Äôs or Engineering degree in IT, Data Science.
- Related field. MS Azure Data Engineer (MS Certified) is preferred.
EXPERIENCES:
- Minimum 3 to 5 year of experience in successfully role of Data Engineer.
- Minimum 1 year of experience in AI Generative.
- Azure Synapse Link hands on experience is an advantage.
COMPETENCIES:
- Very strong @ SQL-PL SQL-Spark SQL
- Interaction with No SQL Databases
- Interaction with Event Hub, IoT Hub Databases
- Files Processing XML, CSV, Excel, Jason, etc. formats
- Structured and Non-Structured Data processing
- Data ETL Capabilities.
- Knowledge of Distributed Big Data Processing
- Data Warehouse and Data Lake Implementation experience in past
- Interaction with REST APIs, Web Services
- Proficiency in data programming languages such as Python, R, Java, C#, and tools like Jupyter, VS Studio Code
LANGUAGES:
- Proficiency in English.
OTHER REQUIREMENTS:
- Customer-focused with excellent verbal and written communication skills.
- Ability to collaborate with globally diverse teams and work flexibly.
- Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving skills.
- A team player with a willingness to learn and adapt in a fast-paced environment.

listJob.description:
At OL Vietnam, we have been working with our sister company Orange Logic at empowering our Fortune 100 clients. You‚Äôll work with a team of top developers to build flexible, scalable, and streamlined systems that will define the future of business management.
The company's flagship product is a web-based application designed to manage large-scale media libraries (photos, videos, audio files, documents...). As a direct result of 15+ years of independent R&D, Cortex is the most flexible DAM on the market and the solution chosen by Amazon, BBC, United Nations, National Geographic, WWF,‚Ä¶  to manage their large digital assets libraries
 We are seeking the Technical Project Manager who will manage software implementation projects and serves as a liaison between the business and technical aspects of assigned projects. 
 YOUR MISSION
  Manages assigned projects to ensure adherence to the schedule and scope of the project.
Develops, maintains, and revises proposals for assigned projects including project objectives, technologies, systems, information specifications, timelines, risks, and staffing.
Sets and tracks project milestones; manages and accounts for unforeseen delays, then realigns schedules and expectations as needed.
Establishes and implements project communication plans, providing status updates to affected staff and stakeholders.
Overseeing quality control throughout the project's lifecycle, coordinating the efforts of various teams, and ensuring all are actively working towards established milestones.

3+ years of experience managing complex, cross-functional enterprise software implementations.
Strong technical background/software development experience required.
Ability to motivate groups of people to complete a project on time.
Strong supervisory and leadership skills.
Excellent English verbal and written communication skills.
Excellent interpersonal, negotiation, and conflict-resolution skills.
Excellent time management skills with a proven ability to meet deadlines.
Organized and able to prioritize multiple projects simultaneously.
Technically curious and eager to understand how complex systems work.
Open-minded and willing to venture off the beaten track.
NOTE: Engineering Manager / Solutions Architect / Tech Lead / Technical Project Lead is welcome to apply!

listJob.description:
About the Role
As an AI Engineer, you will be at the forefront of developing and integrating advanced AI technologies into our products. You‚Äôll work on cutting-edge AI solutions such as personalized meal planning, food recognition, coaching copilot, and AI recommendation systems. Collaborating with cross-functional teams, you will design, implement, and deploy AI-driven systems that provide innovative, user-centric solutions.
What You‚Äôll Do
Design, develop, and fine-tune machine learning and AI models, including
Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), LLMs, and recommendation systems.
Build and maintain workflows for multi-agent systems, agent workflows, and Personal AI Assistants.
Integrate and optimize personalized coaching and meal planning algorithms.
Work with large datasets to preprocess, analyze, and extract meaningful insights.
Collaborate with Product and Engineering teams to deploy AI models into production environments.
Continuously experiment and innovate, leveraging the latest advancements inAI and data science.
listJob.jobExperience:
Technologies We Use
AI/ML Stack: Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), Large Language Models (LLMs), fine-tuning techniques, multi-agent systems, agent workflows.
Development Languages: Python, TypeScript
Infrastructure: TensorFlow, PyTorch, LangChain, Hugging Face, GCP, Serverless architecture
Data & Tools: SQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Redis, Pandas, NumPy
Recommendation Systems: Personal AI Assistant, collaborative filtering,content-based filtering
Required Skills & Experience
Educational Background: Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs in Computer Science, Data Science, Machine Learning, or related field.
Experience: 2+ years of professional experience in AI/ML or data scienceroles, with a proven track record of deploying AI solutions in production.
Technical Expertise:
Proficient in machine learning, deep learning, and natural language processing techniques.
Experience working with LLMs, fine-tuning, and multi-agent systems.
Strong understanding of recommendation systems, including collaborative and content-based filtering.
Familiarity with AI workflows, including RAG, agent workflows, and personalization strategies.
Programming Skills: Proficient in Python, with experience in AI/ML frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, and LangChain.
Data Handling: Experience working with large datasets, data preprocessing, and analytics using tools like Pandas and NumPy.
Soft Skills: A team player with strong problem-solving skills, the ability to communicate complex ideas effectively, and a passion for innovation.

listJob.description:
ABOUT US
 Live Payments is one of Australia's leading payment serviceproviders, servicing thousandsof businesses acrossAustralia. We continue to innovate our payment solutions and expand our product offering alongside our industry leadingstrategic partners including Qantas Loyalty and Prospa.
 ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES
 Live Payments is seeking a talented and experienced Full stack Developer to join our growing/ multi-national team. Reporting directly to our Vietnam based Team Leader, the Full stack Developer will work on developing and maintainour existing and future products.
 Core dutiesinclude:
   Develop and implement user interfaces using modern front-end technologies.
 Troubleshoot and resolve end-user issues and optimize automated processes.
 Design, develop, and maintain robust backend APIs to support application functionality.
 Conduct thorough unit testing to ensure the reliability and quality of code.
 Analyse system errors, identify root causes, and implement effective solutions.
 Collaborate with stakeholders to clarify project requirements and recommend improvements.
 Test and validate software updates and fixes to ensure they meet functional requirements.
 Prepare and maintain comprehensive technical documentation, including SRS and design documents.
 Manage technical tasks and projects with minimal supervision while meeting deadlines.
 Acquire and demonstrate in-depth knowledge of related systems and technologies.
 Propose and design enhancements to improve the functionality and performance of existing applications.
 Actively contribute to troubleshooting and resolving application issues in a timely manner.
 Identify and implement strategies to optimize the performance of system processes.
 Engage with IT teams and user communities to facilitate effective communication and collaboration.
 Undertake additional responsibilities and tasks as required to support team objectives.
listJob.jobExperience:
Required skills:
   Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related discipline, or equivalent professional experience.
 At least 3 years of proven experience in full-stack development within the information technology sector.
 Advanced proficiency in JavaScript (ES6+), Node.js, React.js, Next.js, and NestJS.
 Extensive knowledge of front-end development, including CSS and Material-UI.
 Strong expertise in designing and integrating RESTful APIs and working with relational databases such as MS SQL, MySQL, and PostgreSQL.
 Solid understanding of Object-Oriented Programming (OOP), design patterns, and scalable software architectures.
 Practical experience with development tools, including Jira, Confluence, and Bitbucket.
 Familiarity with Agile methodologies and frameworks, including Scrum.
 Excellent communication skills, with a strong command of the English language.
 Demonstrated problem-solving abilities, self-motivation, and capacity to work both independently and collaboratively.
 A proactive and adaptable approach to contributing within dynamic team environments.
 Desired skills:
   Strong understanding of Service-Oriented Architecture (SOA) and Microservices.
 Hands-on experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS), including Lambda.
 Proficiency in implementing Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) pipelines.
 Experience working with NoSQL databases such as MongoDB, DynamoDB, or similar.

listJob.name: Automation QA Engineer (English/remote)
listJob.location: ., Kh√°c, TP H·ªì Ch√≠ Minh
listJob.description:
Location: Vietnam / Remote
Reports to: Technical Lead
Contract: Contractor, Full-time
 We are looking for an experienced and detail-oriented QA Tester to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for ensuring the quality, functionality, and performance of our web and mobile applications. Your expertise will help us deliver exceptional user experiences while maintaining high standards of software reliability and security.
 Key Responsibilities
  Develop and execute comprehensive test plans, test cases, and test reports to ensure all project requirements are thoroughly assessed.
Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including developers, designers, and product managers, to define quality objectives and troubleshoot issues.
Analyze the outcomes of testing processes and recommend innovative solutions to address identified issues and improve product quality.
Utilize industry-standard testing tools such as Selenium WebDriver, Appium, Cypress, Postman, and others to automate and streamline testing processes.
Contribute to the development of robust test scripts and frameworks for mobile platforms (Android/iOS) using Appium, ensuring seamless functionality across devices.
Conduct thorough API automation testing and ensure system integrations meet performance and reliability standards.
Leverage SQL expertise to verify data integrity and identify any database-related defects.
Identify and resolve software issues through strong analytical, debugging, and problem-solving skills.
Work within an Agile development environment, actively participating in sprints, stand-ups, and retrospectives to support continuous delivery and iterative improvement.
Maintain a strong commitment to achieving quality excellence and security across all deliverables.
listJob.jobExperience:
Required Skills and Qualifications
  A minimum of 2+ years of commercial experience in QA testing for both web and mobile applications.
Proven experience with test automation tools and frameworks, especially in creating and executing automated tests using Selenium WebDriver, Appium, Cypress, Postman, etc.
2+ years of experience specifically in test scripting or framework development for mobile platforms (Android/iOS) using Appium.
Knowledge and experience with API automation testing tools and methodologies is highly desirable.
Proficiency in writing and executing SQL queries to verify data consistency and troubleshoot database issues.
A passion for quality assurance and delivering secure, high-performing products.
Strong communication skills in English (written, spoken, and reading comprehension) to effectively collaborate with an international team.
Experience working in Agile/Scrum environments, with an understanding of sprint-based workflows and iterative product development.
 Preferred Qualifications
  Demonstrated ability to adapt to changing requirements and priorities in a fast-paced environment.
Experience identifying and implementing process improvements to enhance testing efficiency.

listJob.name: Technical Lead ‚Äì Java, Spring Boot
listJob.location: 26 Thao Dien Street, Thao Dien, Thu Duc, HCMC, Th√†nh ph·ªë Th·ªß ƒê·ª©c, TP H·ªì Ch√≠ Minh
listJob.description:
Job Summary 
 If you are a self-starter, wanting multiple opportunities to design, drive and contribute to the development of enterprise applications that drive planning and revenue growth, we are looking for an enthusiastic technical lead, a skilled and experienced full stack developer. The ideal candidate will be demonstrably skilled, have strong expertise in Java and Spring Boot, and hands-on experience in designing, developing, and deploying scalable enterprise applications. The candidate will play a critical role in product design and development and help mentor junior developers.
 Excellent leadership and communication skills required. Excellent analysis, design and development skills required. Solid mathematics skills required. Intermediate English skills required. 
 Responsibilities 
Design, develop, and maintain scalable Java applications. 
Collaborate with team and stakeholders to analyze requirements. 
Implement efficient algorithms, optimize applications, and seamlessly integrate. 
Write clean, testable, and efficient code adhering to best practices. 
Develop RESTful APIs and integrate third-party APIs. 
Integrate APIs with SQL databases, ensuring data integrity and efficiency.  
Write unit and integration tests to ensure functionality and reliability of API endpoints. 
Troubleshoot and debug applications to resolve technical issues. 
Lead code reviews and provide constructive feedback to team members. 
Create clear and concise documentation (docs-as-code) for code and APIs. 
Ensure application security and compliance with industry and regional standards. 
Ensure design and code meet the goals of applications while minimizing technical debt. 
Stay updated with the latest technologies and tools in Java development and apply them to improve existing solutions.
listJob.jobExperience:
Qualifications 
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer science, software engineering, or related field. 
Seven or more years of experience in Java development, with 3 years of software engineering experience, and 2 years proven experience as technical lead. 
Solid experience with design patterns, UML, working with software architectures to create detailed designs. 
Knowledge of Java and J2EE/Java EE (including servlets, JSP, JSF, JDBC). 
Proficiency in Java frameworks such as Spring, Spring Boot, and Hibernate. 
Strong knowledge of object-oriented programming (OOP) including inheritance, interfaces, exception handling, and design patterns. 
Strong understanding of Java threading, concurrency, concurrency patterns, experience building thread safe code. 
Solid experience with RESTful APIs, Microservices, and Web Services and best practices. 
Solid Experience with SQL and relational databases such as MySQL, PostgreSQL, or SQL Server. 
Experience with analytics engines and message queuing systems such as Cube, Spark and Kafka.  
Experience with UI development and front-end technologies from JavaFX to HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and React. 
Experience with other components of the Spring ecosystem (e.g. Spring Data, Spring Security, Spring Cloud, etc.). 
Good understanding of containerization tools Docker and Kubernetes. 
Experience with IntelliJ and GIT or similar source code versioning tools and coding standards. 
Solid skills in statistics, probability, and linear algebra. 
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. 
Excellent communication and teamwork abilities. 
Passionate leadership skills. Mentor team members. Coach team to experiment and solve technical problems in proactive and unique ways. 
Experience collaborating with business, engineering, operational, and product stakeholders, spanning business requirements, functional specifications, and test plans. 
Maintaining a constant focus on the applications delivering client value. 
Good English language skills. 
 Preferred 
Proven ability to plan, develop, and deliver S&OP applications. 
Good understanding of NoSQL databases, like MongoDB, data warehouses, and OLAP. 
Knowledge of Linux and common tech stacks. 
Knowledge of cloud services like AWS or Azure. 
Familiarity with DevOps practices, toolchains and CI/CD pipelines. 
Previous experience working in a Startup environment. 
Previous experience working in an Agile/Scrum environment. 
 Extras 
Proven, hands-on experience architecting complex applications using various architecture styles like Microservices, REST, Streaming, Event, Batch, etc. 
Proven ability to learn new technologies quickly, build POCs, perform a comparative analysis of tools and technologies, and make adoption recommendations. 
Proven ability to deliver architecture and code that meets the goals of our applications while minimizing technical debt. 
Own the quality of the product, from software architecture to end-user quality.
listJob.privilege:
Benefits 
Income negotiated according to experience and ability, with bonus up to 15th month salary based on excellent performance and annual business results. 
Social insurance, health insurance, unemployment insurance after signing the official labor contract. 
Orientation, training and mentoring to master knowledge of product and enterprise-scale operations, and gain professional business communication and presentation skills. 
Empowered to experiment with opensource and Linux lab environments. 
Working in a friendly, young business environment.

About the job:
We are looking for qualified Front-end software developer to work in our UP Delivery team:
You will work in a cluster of small, agile teams, together with fellow BA and QA.
Together with the team in Europe, you will grow familiar with the various Unifiedpost UP Delivery projects.
You will be the first person to be contacted by BA & testers, when questions pop up.  Maybe you can assist directly.  Or maybe you‚Äôll reach out to the Product Owner to find the answer.
Main tasks:
Investigate and perform root cause analysis for product and service problems
Thoroughly describe and document edge-case problematic scenarios and identifies long term solutions
Work closely with QA to build qualitative web applications
Develop applications based on user stories
For both assignments you will assist in writing technical documentation on the software that was developed.

Web API knowledge: REST, GraphQL

Familiarity with AWS, Jira, Agile, Concept of Business Process Workflow
Database knowledge: SQL, NoSQL flavors

Soft Skills:
A proactive personality, taking ownership, with a focus on finding solutions rather than finding problems, and thinking about continuous improvement - always improving tools and methods for yourself and your colleagues
An excellent communicator - English is our group‚Äôs common language, so excellent spoken and written English is a conditional.
You value team effort, are a team player and deliver autonomously with little supervision 
Always curious about new technologies and development methods
You are sociable, seek help from others and follow-up in order to move things forward.

listJob.description:
Skedulo Introduction:
Here at Skedulo, we‚Äôre on a mission to support the 2.7 billion people in the world‚Äîand the companies that employ them‚Äîwho do not work at a desk every day. Our global teams are collaborative, ambitious, innovative, and passionate about helping our customers realize their fullest potential by enabling their mobile workforces.
The Skedulo team is a tight-knit group of builders who are passionate about shaping the future of how work gets done outside of the traditional office setting. We are looking for motivated, self-starters who share our values, challenge the status quo, and push the pace of innovation to accelerate growth. If you‚Äôre drawn to solving hard problems and want to help develop software that will make a difference in people‚Äôs lives, Skedulo is for you. Visit our  to learn more about what Skedulo does and to learn more about our people and team.
Job Description:
The Front-End Developer (Engineer) will be a key member of the Delivery team in the VN. Engineers display a solid understanding of core engineering concepts. They are focused on growing as an engineer, learning the team‚Äôs tools and current processes, as well as a strong background in Engineering best-practices like automated testing, source control, and agile planning.
They communicate well and are capable of delivering feedback to peers and their manager. When given a task with unclear requirements they know how to ask for clarification, and ensure that all assumptions are vetted before work starts to reduce the need for re-work. They understand how their work fits into the larger picture for their team, and use this to identify conflicting requirements to their team lead and project manager.
Responsibilities:
Day to Day
Work on projects with high complexity, large or strategic projects.
Writing and reviewing code from the sprint backlog in line with front-end team best practices
Assisting in driving team sprint execution to ensure timelines are met without compromising on quality.
Anticipates and communicates blockers or delays for their work (or their squads) before they require escalation.
Technical Duties
Consistently writes production-ready code that is easily testable, easily understood by other engineers, and accounts for edge cases and errors. 
Provides technical advice and weighs in on technical discussions/decisions that impact their team.
Ensures their commitments are realistic, understands their priority and urgency, and delivers upon them accordingly.
Communication & Leadership Duties
Communicate within your team in an effective, clear, concise manner in both written and verbal form on technical and nontechnical subjects. 
Helps their fellow team members overcome obstacles, resolve blockers, and complete work tasks. 
Mentors more junior teammates in an open, respectful, flexible, and empathetic manner.

listJob.name: IT Business Analyst (IT BA) Specialist
listJob.location: Unit 3, Floor 11, Bitexco Financial Tower, 2 Hai Trieu Street, Ben Nghe, Qu·∫≠n 1, TP H·ªì Ch√≠ Minh
listJob.description:
We are looking for an IT Business Analyst (IT BA) with a technology background and expertise focusing on way4 and API integration. The candidate will act as a liaison between business stakeholders and technical teams, be responsible for translating business needs into technical solutions, ensuring the successful delivery of IT change requests in a timely manner. The ideal candidate should also have experience in Change Requests (CRs) life cycle management across various systems, including mobile, frontend, backend, and core systems.
Main Responsibilities
1. Business Requirement Analysis
Collaborate with business stakeholders to gather, analyze, and document functional and non-functional requirements for mobile, frontend, backend, and core systems. 
Translate business requirements into technical specifications, ensuring they align with system capabilities, including APIs, cloud infrastructure, microservice architecture standards, databases. 
Conduct impact analysis for new change requests or enhancements, considering the effects on various IT layers and systems. 
2. Solution Design
Work with technical teams to define integration points between different systems and technologies; develop clear and concise functional specifications for APIs, microservices, data flow, database structures.
3. Change Request (CR) Execution and Management
Manage the lifecycle of CRs across mobile, frontend, backend, and core systems.
Coordinate with business and technical teams to prioritize and deliver CRs based on business value and technical feasibility.
Track CR status and progress daily, ensuring all stakeholders are frequently informed of changes and expected outcomes.
Assist in testing plan and execution, ensuring all CRs are thoroughly tested across all impacted systems, regression testing suggestion.
Evaluate system performance, identify bottlenecks, and recommend improvements, particularly for APIs, microservices, databases.
4. Documentation
Document functional and technical specifications, user stories, and use cases for all CRs and new system integrations.
Provide regular updates on project and CR progress, including timelines, challenges, and resource requirements.
5. Application Operation
Monitor application health, logs, and alerts to proactively identify and address potential issues for web and core applications in production environments.
Implement and enforce operational best practices, including incident response and root cause analysis.
listJob.jobExperience:
Qualification Requirements
Technical Skills
Experience with designing, integrating, and managing APIs across systems. 
Knowledge of relational and NoSQL databases, SQL, and database design practices. 
Experience with integration techniques and protocols such as REST, SOAP, and messaging systems (e.g., Kafka, ActiveMQ). 
Soft Skills
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and troubleshooting skills.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to work across teams.
Ability to manage multiple change requests simultaneously in a fast-paced environment.
Education and Experience
Degree: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
Experience:
Minimum 3+ years in a business analyst, system analyst, or similar role.
Proven experience working with APIs, microservices, databases.
Experience with CR management across frontend, backend, and core systems, particularly in an enterprise environment.
 Preferred Qualifications:
Experience in Fintech or Banking sector. 
Experience with way4 core platform (OpenWay). 
Certifications in business analysis (e.g., CBAP, CCBA)

listJob.name: Senior QA Automation Engineer
listJob.location: 21-23 Nguy·ªÖn Th·ªã Minh Khai, B·∫øn Ngh√©, Qu·∫≠n 1, TP H·ªì Ch√≠ Minh
listJob.description:
We're looking for people to join the Access family, who share our passion for believing in better, and who will help us continue to grow.
Love Work. Love Life. Be You. - is central to our success and how we give our customers the freedom to do more of what's important to them.
What does Access offer you?
We offer a blended approach to office working, expecting you to collaborate and connect in one of our thriving offices on average three days per week. We deliver on what we say, taking the development of our people seriously. We'll work with you to progress your success plan and provide opportunities to accelerate your career.
On top of a competitive salary, our wellbeing days taking you to 25 days leave a year and a health contribution, you'll also be able to choose from a range of benefits to suit you. We're an organisation that likes to give back, so you'll also have three charity days allocated to support a cause that matters to you.

About you:
You are a talented and passion driven individual who values working in a fast-growing environment, delivering high quality client-oriented services and collaborating with your peers.
You are a motivated, detail oriented, technical and energetic person who works well in a fast-paced, dynamic small-team environment. You learn quickly and are passionate about helping others.
As a Quality Assurance Specialist you will become one of the first members of the QA team to support our passionate Product Development Team with the Product testing (Manual and Automation Testing).
You will be working with our development team to define the QA strategies through detailed but easy to follow test plans.
In performing your tasks you will work with a team of QA specialists by using a variety of testing tools, formats and learning the best practices that we follow. (Automation testing through Playwright)

Key Responsibilities:
- Problem Solving: Clarify requirements, create test strategies, and focus testing on areas needing improvement.
- Testing: Develop automation tests, execute manual testing, and resolve defects with the Product Development team.
- Consultation: Guide QA members and align testing processes within the team.
- Learning & Collaboration: Engage in team discussions and adopt continuous learning practices.
- Documentation: Maintain technical documents for seamless knowledge sharing.
listJob.jobExperience:
Requirements:
Must Have:
- Minimum 5+ years of QA experience, with proficiency in both manual and automated testing.
- Strong understanding of fundamental programming concepts.
- Knowledge of at least one test automation framework such as Playwright, Katalon, Selenium etc.
- Familiarity with software development tools and version control systems (e.g., Git).
- Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work collaboratively in a team.
- Good English communication skills, both verbal and written.
Nice to Have:
- Bachelor's degree in computer science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
- Coding experience in Python and/or Typescript (React).
- Understanding of Agile and Scrum software development methodologies.
- Eagerness to learn and adapt to new technologies and tools.
listJob.privilege:
What does Access offer you?
A very attractive salary package
20 annual leave days per year+public holidays
Hybrid flexible working mode
Social Insurance on Gross salary
Yearly health check-ups
Bao Viet Premium medical insurance
13th month salary
Parking fee allowance
Annual company trip
Monthly events, Team outings, company parties, and other exciting events every quarter
Overtime rarely required. OT policies apply for every product release.
What are we all about?
The Access Group is one of the largest UK-headquartered providers of business management software to small and mid-sized organisations in the UK, Ireland, USA and Asia Pacific. It helps more than‚ÄØ100,000 customers across commercial and non-profit sectors become more productive and efficient. Our products and solutions go beyond providing technology, we connect the right people with the right data, at the right time, through Access Workspace.
At Access, we are committed to creating a welcoming and inclusive environment where everyone can thrive. If you're excited about this role, (even if your previous experience doesn't align perfectly), you might just be the perfect fit for us! We wholeheartedly believe in equality for all and the transformative power of diversity.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ Why not join our vibrant team where you can love what you do, love how you live, and most importantly, be authentically you? Let's make a difference together.
Love Work. Love Life. Be You.

listJob.location: 15th Floor, Pearl 5, 5 Le Quy Don, Vo Thi Sau Ward, Qu·∫≠n 3, TP H·ªì Ch√≠ Minh
listJob.description:
About Thoughtworks
Thoughtworks is a global technology consultancy that integrates strategy, design and engineering to drive digital innovation. For 30+ years, our clients have trusted our autonomous teams to build solutions that look past the obvious. Here, computer science grads come together with seasoned technologists, self-taught developers, midlife career changers and more to learn from and challenge each other. Career journeys flourish with the strength of our cultivation culture, which has won numerous awards around the world.
Join Thoughtworks and thrive. Together, our extra curiosity, innovation, passion and dedication overcomes ordinary.
 About Job
Lead Developers act as the primary point of contact for our clients, ensuring that teams are successful in their delivery. In this role, you will bring a strategic mindset to projects and spend time negotiating with clients to bring a technical vision to life. Having a balance of high-level and tactical mindsets is a must, as you will spend time both with clients and your teammates.
 Job responsibilities
You will oversee or take part in the entire cycle of software consulting and delivery from ideation to deployment and everything in between
You will design solutions and choose technologies that solve clients' problems while staying within constraints
You will use continuous delivery practices to improve software delivery speed
You will work in collaborative, product-focused teams to build innovative customer experiences and create meaningful change for a variety of clients
Utilize the latest technology thinking from our in your work
Apply a variety of languages to your work and continue to code alongside Developers; you will never go post-technical in this role
listJob.jobExperience:
Technical Skills:
You're well-versed in two or more languages (with C# as the primary language, and Java, Javascript, etc.) and are comfortable with the latest Object-Oriented technology
You have led software development teams using Agile, Lean and/or Continuous Delivery approaches such as TDD, continuous integration, pairing and infrastructure automation
We would love it if you're up to speed on functional programming paradigms and languages like Clojure, Scala, etc.
Bonus points if you have knowledge of cloud technology such as AWS, Docker or Kubernetes.
Professional Skills:
You have experience influencing others and always advocate for technical excellence while being open to change when needed
The ability to develop and execute a technical vision with a focus on business value
You will act as a mentor for less experienced peers through both your technical knowledge and ability to inspire a team to deliver extraordinary impact together
You're resilient in ambiguous situations and can approach challenges from multiple perspectives
Other Things To Know:
Learning & Development
There is no one-size-fits-all career path at Thoughtworks: however you want to develop your career is entirely up to you. But we also balance autonomy with the strength of our cultivation culture. This means your career is supported by interactive tools, numerous development programs and teammates who want to help you grow. We see value in helping each other be our best and that extends to empowering our employees in their career journeys.
listJob.privilege:
At Thoughtworks, we believe technology can be a powerful force for good. That's why our purpose is to create an extraordinary impact on the world through our culture and technology excellence. This isn't just a slogan, it's the core principle guiding every decision we make. 
 We achieve this through a relentless pursuit of excellence and a culture built around these five core values:

listJob.location: 15th Floor, Pearl 5, 5 Le Quy Don, Vo Thi Sau Ward, Qu·∫≠n 3, TP H·ªì Ch√≠ Minh
listJob.description:
As a senior Systems Support Engineer you will play a critical role in ensuring the operational efficiency, stability and availability of complex application systems. You will contribute significantly to operational success, refine your expertise in incident management and DevOps and leave a lasting impact on the delivery of inventive solutions to our clients.
 Job Responsibilities:
You will use your skills in incident management processes and tools, application monitoring metrics and tooling to generate reports and take corrective actions.
You will understand complex application systems and find your way through them to debug a business impacting issue.
You will follow standards and best practices to bring operational efficiencies, stability and availability of the system.
You will use continuous delivery practices to evolve, support and deliver high-quality software, as well as value to end customers, as early as possible while working in a collaborative, value-driven teams to build innovative customer experiences for our clients.
You will leverage your knowledge regarding the different logging techniques (various levels) and use them for alerting, monitoring and identifying the root cause of incidents.
You will efficiently use DevOps tools and practices to deploy and run software.
You will act as a mentor for less experienced peers through both your technical knowledge and leadership skills.
You will apply the latest technology thinking from our to solve client problems.
listJob.jobExperience:

You have experience working programming languages such as .Net (C#), Ruby and Java, an understanding of cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure or GCP and scripting languages such as Python and Powershell.
You have a high-level understanding of various architectures such as monolithic, N-tier, layered, microservices and serverless.
You must possess strong debugging and triaging skills to troubleshoot code effectively.
You have experience working with relational databases such as MS SQL, MySQL or PostgreSQL.
You have experience working with containerization tools such as Docker and CI/CD tools such as Jenkins and Azure pipelines.
You have experience working with relational or non-relational databases.

You are comfortable with Agile methods, such as Scrum and/or Kanban.

You enjoy influencing others and always advocate for technical excellence while being open to change, when needed.
You have good communication and articulation skills.
You have a presence in the external tech community and willingly share your expertise with others via speaking engagements, contributions to open source, blogs and more.
You are resilient in ambiguous situations and can approach challenges from multiple perspectives.
You advocate for and implement cloud best practices in the areas of resource optimization, monitoring and alerting.

You can guide and mentor junior-level consultants.

listJob.name: Business/Application Analyst
listJob.location: Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
listJob.description:
Merchant Mate is developing a Merchant POS apps with a diverse functionality and a variety of modules including inventory management, Time management, services and appointments, e-marketing, online marketplace and much more.  We are looking for a dynamic business analysist based in our Ho Chi Minh operation, who can study analyse, design and improve the business requirements and interface with the developer and product manager to help MerchantMate to deliver a product that delivers the expected value to the users and help businesses to increase productivity. The product is quite in the final stages of development and as a business analyst, you should be hands on in analysing, designing and improving the systems. The knowledge of designing and modifying the UI/UX will be a added advantage. The prerequisite for the job is that you must be proficient in English and Vietnamese languages.
 Responsibilities:
Data collection and Bench Marking
Interact with the stakeholders and collect valid information about business needs, process flow and 
Collect further market information from competitors and do bench marking studies to improve and create competitiveness 
Study the existing system and generate professional reports and optimized proposal to seek improvements and new designs 
Specification and Documentation
Based on your study and discussion with stakeholders, developers and product managers create specification and documentation 
The solution proposed should be compatible with organisational resources and capabilities and at the same time must create value for the user in an optimised manner. 
Propose and prepare UI/UX new design modification for backend and mobile apps that are web-based, Android and iOS platforms 
Create detailed documents for different teams such as Product owner, developers and testers
Project coordination and monitoring
Play in important role in the required meeting with the developer to make the understand the project specification
Monitor the development and testing stages using Agile project management tools 
Coordinate with tester to ensure that project and test cases specification are met functionally and aesthetically 
 Your application will include the following questions:
What's your expected monthly basic salary?
How many years' experience do you have as a Business Analyst or UI/UX designer?
Do you have a Bachelor Degree?
listJob.jobExperience:
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field (or equivalent work experience).
Proficient in speaking and writing English is must 
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Effective communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability and experience in data collection and bench marking techniques
Knowledge of UI and UX in general and advanced requirements for better user experience.
Experience working with Zira desirable
Ability to work as a team member and impress upon your positive points.
Experience with UI/UX design using Figma or any other graphics tools
listJob.privilege:

- Professional and challenging working environment
- Competitive and performance-oriented remuneration system
- Friendly colleague
- Promotion & bonus opportunities
- Long-term commitment

listJob.name: Senior AI Engineer
listJob.location: Sabay Building, 427 Truong Chinh Street, 14 Ward, Qu·∫≠n T√¢n B√¨nh, TP H·ªì Ch√≠ Minh
listJob.description:
YOU
You want to be an important member of a strong team of other makers who take pride in their work and support each other. As a Senior AI Engineer, you will be responsible for handling certain projects and working directly with our US stakeholders. That‚Äôs year one. If career growth is important to you, we not only know how to help you with that, it‚Äôs what we love to do:
 PROJECT DESCRIPTION
Pipeline Takeoff (PTO) is a web-based application that allows you to plan and manage your projects within one cohesive platform. This includes the ability to upload digital blueprints, record measurements, and create fast and accurate estimates.
Document Intelligence is an Azure AI Service that supports PTO tool not only for auto-name sheets but also to validate scales on the house design. Additionally, AI OCR assists users in auto take-off key measures for repeated objects such as doors, lights, etc. Through the integration of AI in PTO, service takeoff challenges can astutely be resolved by leveraging the "potential features" that have been developing.

 WHAT YOU‚ÄôLL BE DOING
At Simpson Strong-Tie we value the individual, and the creativity that individuals can bring to the workplace. You join this company for a career, not a job!
You will join the AI engineering team at the most innovative manufacturing and construction with US Team to build and develop AI services to help the product market improve its performance.  
You enjoy working in a cross-functional environment, collaborating with product managers, software engineers, designers, data analytics, data engineers, and business stakeholders. 
You will also be responsible for creating and optimizing core modules of the MLOps platform, from the computation layer to the orchestrator layer.  
Working alongside our data scientists, you will enhance their workflows by providing efficient and effective solutions developed by the MLOps team. 
Help coordinate schedules with SST Product Development, the Takeoff Tool Team and Vendor. 
Follow up with Vendor closely to make sure alignment of between PTO and Auto-assist takeoff   
Research, create and deploy AI/ML algorithm
listJob.jobExperience:
If you can do everything listed above, you‚Äôve got what it takes. Perhaps some of the following would be helpful too: 
Experience of at least 3 years in Software Development 
Experience of at least 3 years in AI, Machine Learning, Data Science roles. 
Strong technical hands-on experience in Python. 
Design, develop and maintain scalable and resilient AI/ML products, e.g. Recommendations system & Personalization, Chatbot, Search, Forecasting, etc. You are responsible for end-to-end machine learning product life cycle. 
Apply technical expertise with quantitative analysis, experimentation, data mining, and the presentation of data to develop strategies for our machine learning products. 
Solid knowledge of Machine Learning fundamental i.e. knowledge of model‚Äôs variant and use cases, end-to-end ML lifecycle process, model development, model selection, hyperparameter optimization, feature engineering, evaluation. 
Strong hands-on experience in Machine Learning algorithms & libraries like Tensorflow, Pytorch, Keras, Scikit, Pandas. 
Monitoring the performance of the MLOps platform and proactively identifying areas for optimization. This includes analyzing system performance, ensuring low latency, and optimizing cloud resource consumption for cost-effective operations. 
Design, implement, and optimize the core modules of our MLOps platform. This includes developing solutions that enhance our machine learning workflows‚Äô scalability, efficiency, and robustness. 
Proven track record of operating independently, stakeholder management, demonstrating creativity, and delivering results. 
Hands-on experience with cloud providers such as Google Cloud Platform (GCP) or Amazon Web Services (AWS) or Microsoft Azure. Your familiarity with cloud services and infrastructure will be essential in architecting scalable and reliable MLOps solutions. 
Practical experience of ML modeling, involving the entire process from conceptualizing ideas to developing, evaluating, and deploying models, with the added advantage of having expertise in monitoring and managing model performance after deployment. 
Good verbal and written communication in English is required.

We are looking for a skilled and creative Front-End Developer with expertise in eCommerce to join our team. You will be responsible for building, optimizing, and maintaining responsive and engaging eCommerce websites that deliver excellent user experiences. Your role will involve collaborating with our design, back-end, and marketing teams to implement high-quality front-end code and user interfaces that enhance our customers' shopping experience.
 JOB DESCRIPTIONS
Build, maintain and customize responsive storefronts on Shopify/Woocommerce/BigCommerce/Magento using HTML, CSS, JavaScript.
Collaborate with UX/UI designers and back-end developers to bring website mockups to life.
Work closely with the marketing team to implement and update SEO best practices on websites.

Stay up to date with the latest eCommerce, front-end, and platform trends to continually improve the user experience.

Producing high quality of work with a strong focus on detail.

A positive and upbeat attitude with the ability to learn quickly.
Always strive to keep learning new things.

listJob.name: Senior Live Ops Manager (Data Analyst/ Games)
listJob.location: 666, ƒë∆∞·ªùng 3 Th√°ng 2, Ph∆∞·ªùng 14, Qu·∫≠n 10, Th√†nh ph·ªë H·ªì Ch√≠ Minh, Qu·∫≠n 10, TP H·ªì Ch√≠ Minh
listJob.description:
Snow Game Studio, formerly known as Mirai Labs, is an established powerhouse in the mobile gaming industry with a proven track record of delivering engaging and innovative games. Our history is marked by the incredible success of our flagship title, Pegaxy, which reached an astonishing 27 million users and became one of the most prominent Web3 games globally.
Building on this momentum, Snow Game Studio continues to push the boundaries of mobile game development, focusing on casual games that blend cutting-edge technology with captivating gameplay experiences. Join us as wetake our next big leap in revolutionizing the mobile gaming landscape.
Role Overview: 
We are seeking a highly experienced Senior Live Ops Manager to oversee and manage the live operations of our mobile game portfolio. This role is crucial for driving player engagement, retention, and monetization through the management of in-game events, promotions, and content updates. The ideal candidate has a deep understanding of the live ops process, player behavior, and a passion for optimizing game experiences to ensure our titles stay fresh, exciting, and profitable.
Key Responsibilities:
Live Operations Management: 
Lead the planning, execution, and optimization of in-game events, promotions, and content updates to drive player engagement and retention. 
Develop and implement strategies for live ops campaigns, ensuring they align with overall game design, player behavior, and monetization goals. 
Monitor and analyze the performance of live events, identifying opportunities for improvement and implementing data-driven changes to enhance effectiveness. 
Collaboration & Communication: 
Work closely with game designers, product managers, marketing teams, and data analysts to ensure live ops activities are integrated seamlessly into the overall game experience.
Communicate live ops plans and outcomes to internal stakeholders, ensuring all teams are aligned and informed about ongoing and upcoming events. 
Data Analysis & Reporting: 
Analyze player behavior, game metrics, and market trends to optimize live operations strategies, ensuring maximum player engagement and revenue generation. 
Provide regular reports on the performance of live ops campaigns, highlighting key insights, successes, and areas for improvement. 
Content Management & Planning: 
Oversee the creation and scheduling of live content, including events, sales, seasonal updates, and special promotions. 
Work with the game development team to ensure the seamless implementation of new features, content, and updates that enhance live ops campaigns. 
Player Engagement & Retention: 
Design and implement strategies to improve player engagement and retention through targeted live ops initiatives. 
Actively monitor player feedback and community sentiment to adjust live operations and ensure a positive player experience.
listJob.jobExperience:
Qualifications: 
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Game Design, Marketing, Business, or a related field (Master‚Äôs degree preferred). 
7+ years of experience in live operations management within the mobile gaming industry, with a strong background in casual game titles. 
Proven track record of successfully managing live ops campaigns that drive engagement, retention, and revenue. 
Strong understanding of game metrics, player behavior, and monetization models within casual gaming. 
Exceptional analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets and translate insights into actionable strategies.
 Experience working with analytics tools (e.g., GameAnalytics, Google Analytics, Tableau) to monitor and optimize live ops performance. 
Excellent project management skills with the ability to manage multiple projects and deadlines simultaneously. 
Strong communication and collaboration skills, with experience working in cross-functional teams. 
Familiarity with agile development processes and live ops tools. 
Preferred Skills: 
Experience in managing live ops for Web3 or blockchain-based games. Knowledge of SQL, Excel, or other data analysis tools. 
Understanding of game design principles and player psychology. 
Experience working with game engines like Unity.
listJob.privilege:
What We Offer: 
Competitive salary with above-market rate compensation. 
Opportunity to work on exciting and innovative game projects with a passionate and talented team.
A dynamic and collaborative work environment in either Hanoi or Ho Chi Minh City. 
Career growth and development opportunities within a rapidly expanding game studio. 
Access to the latest tools, technologies, and industry trends. 
Application Process: 
If you are a data-driven and creative thinker with a passion for driving player engagement through live operations, we'd love to hear from you!

listJob.name: AdTech Project Manager
listJob.location: Viettel Tower - 285 Cach Mang Thang 8 street, Ward 12, Qu·∫≠n 10, TP H·ªì Ch√≠ Minh
listJob.description:
WHO ARE WE 
Powered by SQREEM, TotallyAwesome specializes in providing advertisers with secure, compliant solutions for reaching an under-18 audience. By focusing on privacy regulations and age-appropriate content, TotallyAwesome ensures that brands can safely engage with younger consumers while protecting their personal information. Our platform integrates advanced human moderated contextual ad targeting to create a safe environment for both advertisers and young audiences. 
SQREEM leverages AI to help advertisers reach an over-18 audience with precision and efficiency. Our AI-driven platform analyzes consumer behavior, preferences, and patterns to deliver relevant and scalable ad experiences, ensuring that brands connect with their target audience in meaningful and impactful ways. Through AI, SQREEM enables advertisers to understand their audiences, optimize their campaigns and improve engagement. 
 Headquartered in Singapore, we have offices across the globe in Australia, Indonesia, Philippines, Vietnam, Japan, Korea, UAE, London and New York. At SQREEM and TotallyAwesome, you‚Äôll get the opportunity to work with world-class people and industry-leading technology. 
 JOB RESPONSIBILITIES  
Overview:  As a Project Manager for our Tech Studio, you will be responsible for the successful planning, management, execution and delivery of client and internal tasks and projects for APAC. You will work closely with the creative, tech, sales, and account teams and 3rd parties to coordinate a wide variety of online digital marketing, digital creative, and technical projects to successful completion. You will be the key bridge of communication for all of APAC, thus strong English and communications skills are a must. 
 How will YOU contribute to the Team?  
Be responsible for managing projects in the digital production team that will include rich media, mini-games, landing pages, and microsites.  
You will assist with gathering requirements and defining briefs, and then lead the team to deliver effective and creative solutions for clients and internal stakeholders. 
You will set-up and continuously improve processes to manage projects and task for our Tech Studio.  
Leverage different processes such as Kanban and SCRUM and keep detailed project schedules which include administrative tasks and all parties involved in the project. 
Educate internal teams and advocate best practices in project management.  
Responsible for metrics on performance and overall quality. 
Prepare and conduct internal training on related job matters.  
From time to time take lead or assist with other critical tasks as needed to contribute to the success of the company.
listJob.jobExperience:

listJob.description:
At NFQ, we're all about developing cutting-edge apps, CRMs, ERPs, and other cross-platform products. Both for ourselves and for our clients that include HomeToGo, Kayak, Alaiko, Home24, and many others. We specialize in e-commerce, mobility, and transport & logistics, and we're always eager to tackle new challenges. Whatever the area ‚Äì from Mobile to UX  ‚Äì we've got a team that knows it inside out.
Join our team of 800+ professionals across Germany, Poland, Lithuania, Vietnam, Thailand, Singapore, and Egypt. Make your own way with us!
Our organization partners closely with global enterprise clients to drive data-driven transformation and optimize operational performance. We are seeking a Japanese-speaking Project Manager specializing in data projects to serve as the primary liaison with Japanese stakeholders, ensuring the successful execution and delivery of critical data initiatives.
 In this role you will:
In this role, you will work closely with Japanese stakeholders to understand their needs, define project scopes, and ensure the timely and high-quality delivery of data solutions. These projects will range from dashboard and report development to analytics and data governance activities. By balancing strategic vision, technical understanding, and strong stakeholder engagement, you will help drive value from our clients‚Äô data assets.
Stakeholder Collaboration:
Engage directly with Japanese stakeholders to understand business requirements, translate needs into actionable data projects, and maintain clear communication throughout the project lifecycle.
Facilitate regular status updates, workshops, and review sessions, ensuring alignment with stakeholder expectations and organizational objectives.
Project Planning & Execution:
Develop comprehensive project plans, including timelines, milestones, resource allocation, and risk mitigation strategies, ensuring all data initiatives are delivered on-time and within scope.
Monitor progress against project objectives and provide proactive updates to stakeholders and internal teams.
Data Project Management:
Oversee the design, development, and implementation of data-related solutions such as dashboards, reports, analytics models, and data governance frameworks.
Coordinate with internal technical teams (e.g., data engineers, data analysts, BI developers) to ensure accuracy, reliability, and scalability of delivered solutions.
Quality Assurance & Continuous Improvement:
Establish and enforce data governance standards, ensuring deliverables meet quality and compliance criteria.
Continuously seek opportunities to optimize existing processes, enhance reporting capabilities, and improve data quality and accessibility.
Documentation & Reporting:
Maintain clear and concise documentation of project requirements, decisions, progress, and outcomes.
Provide regular performance metrics, insights, and recommendations to support data-driven decision-making at all organizational levels.ion journey.
listJob.jobExperience:
What you will bring:
Language Skills: Good Japanese Speaking, enabling confident communication with both local and international stackholder. 
Experience: 5+ years of experience in project management, with a significant focus on data initiatives (BI dashboards, analytics, data engineering, data governance).
Technical Acumen:
(1) Familiarity with BI tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI), data warehousing concepts, SQL, and analytics methodologies.
(2) Prior experience managing full lifecycle data projects is highly desirable.
(3) Bonus if prior experience with Snowflake and / or Geographic Information System analytics.
Project Management Expertise: Proven experience applying project management methodologies (e.g., Agile, Scrum, Waterfall) and using related tools (e.g., Jira, Asana, MS Project) to ensure on-time and on-budget project delivery.
Interpersonal Skills: Exceptional communication, negotiation, and stakeholder management abilities. Comfortable leading cross-functional teams and guiding them towards shared objectives.
Problem-Solving: Strong analytical and critical thinking skills, with the ability to proactively identify and resolve challenges, ensuring the continuous success of data initiatives.
listJob.privilege:
An opportunity to influence data-driven decision-making within a global corporate environment.
A collaborative, international setting that values innovation, diversity, continuous learning and professional development opportunities.
The only Vietnam's Best IT Company awarded by ITViec for 6 consecutive years.

listJob.name: Senior Security Operations Engineer - SIEM & SOAR
listJob.location: T·∫ßng 28, t√≤a nh√† Opal, s·ªë 92 Nguy·ªÖn H·ªØu C·∫£nh, Ph∆∞·ªùng 22, Qu·∫≠n B√¨nh Th·∫°nh, TP H·ªì Ch√≠ Minh
listJob.description:
Are you passionate about cybersecurity and ready to take a hands-on role in driving the evolution of our security operations? As a Medior/Senior Security Operations Engineer at Aurify, you‚Äôll play a pivotal role in building and refining our Google Security Operations Center (SOC), with a specific focus on SIEM and SOAR solutions.
 You will be part of our Security Operations team, responsible for monitoring and escalating security alerts across our infrastructure and implementing cutting-edge security procedures. This role goes beyond production security and encompasses securing our internal systems and processes. We‚Äôre looking for someone with both practical and theoretical knowledge of IT security, capable of not only enforcing policies but also continuously improving them to meet evolving security challenges.
  What you‚Äôll be doing 
Building and optimizing our Google SOC, including SIEM and SOAR implementation (Google Chronicle)
Monitoring, analyzing, and escalating security alerts from our Google Chronicle SIEM
Developing, evolving, and enforcing security policies and incident response playbooks
Driving the creation of SIEM dashboards and enhancing monitoring and alerting capabilities
Managing and mitigating CVE vulnerabilities on our platforms and base images
Assisting with the implementation of security measures for both external and internal systems
Implementing and automating static code scanning processes to identify and remediate vulnerabilities early in the development lifecycle
Leading efforts in automated security scanning for continuous monitoring of code and infrastructure security
Participating in the on-call security response rotation to handle critical security incidents
listJob.jobExperience:
Requirements
Hands-on experience with SIEM (preferably Google secops / Chronicle) and SOAR solutions
Strong knowledge of CVE management and experience with vulnerability mitigation
Solid understanding of cloud security (GCP and/or AWS)
Practical experience in developing and implementing security policies and incident response plans
Strong command of English (both written and spoken)
Ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams
Experience with Linux systems (RedHat/CentOS) and using Jira for project management
Nice To Have
Knowledge of container security (Docker, Anchore)
Experience with OSSECC, Wazuh, Tenable.io, Burpsuite, Cloudsuite
Familiarity with Ansible, Opsgenie, and Prometheus
Experience with patch management solutions such as Katello/Satellite
AI knowledge to improve and speed up your workflow
Python automation scripting experience
A keen focus on real-world security issues and the ability to differentiate between buzz and practical security
Soft skills 
Excellent communication skills to work constructively and in cooperation with internal and external teams
Be assertive, knowledgeable, and trustworthy
High degree of responsibility and autonomy
listJob.privilege:
Office hours: 9:00 AM ü°™ 12:00 PM, 1:00 PM ü°™ 06:00 PM, off on Saturday and Sunday.

Generous private medical health insurance for employees & family members

As a member of the Aurify team, you'll have the unique opportunity to work on projects that integrate state-of-the-art technologies with a customer-centric approach. You'll be at the forefront of implementing practices that ensure cost management and security compliance, all within a framework that values simplicity and smart solutions, echoing the mission of Unifiedpost. Join us in our journey to navigate the complexities of the cloud landscape together, providing peace of mind and empowering businesses to focus on their core activities with the assurance of performance, high availability and security excellence. 

About our client
Our client‚Äôs mission is to make business easy and smart by helping organizations build strong digital connections with their customers and suppliers.
 Their cloud-based open network of consumers and organizations - small or large, local or global - promotes collaboration, digital interactions, document exchanges, payments, and cash flow optimization. It also enables our client's partners to create additional data-driven services to help organizations grow.
 Our client‚Äôs trusted network equips every verified participant with the right tools to digitize and automate business processes, including order-to-cash and procure-to-pay processes. Those tools range from smart mobile and web applications over software integrations all the way to fully documented APIs.

Our client is gradually transforming into a more regulated company. As a result, all roles within any of our client‚Äôs Group companies are subject to some form of background check. For most roles, this will involve a simple identity and degree verification. For other roles, verifying your criminal record and employment history might also be required.

listJob.name: AWS DevOps Lead
listJob.location: Level 5 - 6, East Tower, Lumiere Riverside, 277 Vo Nguyen Giap, An Phu Ward, Thu Duc City, HCMC., Th√†nh ph·ªë Th·ªß ƒê·ª©c, TP H·ªì Ch√≠ Minh
listJob.description:
We seek a highly skilled and motivated AWS DevOps Lead with a strong background in software development, expertise in AWS Cloud, and a solid understanding of the banking domain. A crucial part of the role is championing and leading infrastructure as code. You will be responsible for implementing tools and processes that enable rapid software development and deployment.
Your mission is to embrace continuous integration/deployment in a delivery pipeline that will perform automated quality checks, deploy cloud infrastructure quickly, and provide operational tooling and metrics that development teams can consume. To succeed, you will have a blend of development experience and operational experience that provides a good understanding of the developers you are working with while balancing critical systems uptime.
Your responsibilities
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and design scalable and maintainable software solutions.
Build integration solutions for seamless communication between microservices, APIs, and third-party systems.
Contribute to developing continuous delivery, automation frameworks, and pipelines to create an excellent experience for developers and customers.
Optimize database interactions and ensure data integrity across distributed systems.
Develop and enforce best practices for messaging, integration, and data pipeline architectures.
Identify and develop opportunities to improve our processes and tools for automation.
Learn new skills and help foster a continuous delivery and cloud-first mindset.
listJob.jobExperience:
7+ years of experience in the field of DevOps including backend development using Python or Java, 
At least 2+ years in a lead role. (DevOps or Technical Lead)
Proficient in Apache Kafka, including Kafka Connect, Schema Registry, etc.
Expertise in building and deploying microservice and event-driven architecture, distributed systems, event sourcing, CQRS patterns, etc..
Experience using AWS foundation services (VPC, ECS, Lambda, RDS, SNS, SQS, Eventbridge, etc..).
Hands-on experience with tools like Kafka Connectors, Debezium, etc..
Solid experience with application integration patterns, RESTful APIs, and messaging protocols.
Able to do hands-on, deep-dive details and work closely with team members to troubleshoot and optimize our platform.
Able to design scalability systems as well as multi-country patterns for our platform
Knowledge of one or more AWS CloudFormation/Terraform/CDK for infrastructure provisioning.
An automation mindset with the ability to develop tooling to improve the efficiency of repeatable tasks, reliability, and performance.
Understanding cloud change management practices with an awareness of compliance and security standards.
Good skills in English and the ability to communicate and coordinate effectively with business partners and technical teams.
Demonstrate good logical thinking and problem-solving skills.
Be curious and have a self-learning attitude.
Big Plus:
AWS Certification Developer Associate or DevOps / SA Professional.
You are:
Passionate about technology
Independent but also a team player
Comfortable with a high degree of ambiguity
Focused on usability and speed
Keen on presenting your ideas to your peers and management.
listJob.privilege:
You‚Äôll love working with us if you are:
Passionate about technology.
Independent but also a good team player.
Comfortable with a high degree of ambiguity.

Meal and parking allowances are covered by the company.

‚ñ† The Opportunity
We are looking for BrSE who will play a role as a communication bridge between the developing teams in Vietnam and Japan to grow our business and Digitalization of the Construction industry dynamically. Working in a squad model alongside a product manager and small agile teams, you will be involved in all project phases, from design and development to testing, deployment, operation, and maintenance. This position provides a great opportunity to work with modern technologies and frameworks in a dynamic international environment.
 ‚ñ† Job Scope
Ensure that all projects are delivered on-time, within scope.
Assist in the definition of project scope and objectives, involving all relevant stakeholders and ensuring technical feasibility.
Delegate project tasks based on members' individual strengths, skill sets and experience.
Perform risk management to minimize project risks.
Track project performance, specifically to analyze the successful completion of short and long-term goals.
Report and escalate to management as needed. 
Create and maintain comprehensive project documentation. 
Manage the relationship with the client and all stakeholders. 
Meet with the ANDPAD Japan team to take detailed ordering briefs and clarify specific requirements of each project.
Manage changes to the project scope, project schedule and project costs using appropriate verification techniques.
Ensure resource availability and allocation. 
‚ñ† Development environment
Backend: Ruby on Rails, Go, AWS, Elasticsearch, MySQL, DynamoDB, Redis, Terraform (IaC), OIDC (Authentication).
FrontEnd: NextJS/ ReactJS, Typescript, Vue.js/ Nuxt.js.

Others: Datadog, Sentry, Bugsnag, Swagger, ZenHub, Figma.

Position Overview: 
As a Project Manager at BII, you will be responsible for planning, executing, and closing projects. You will work closely with our clients and team members to ensure that all project requirements, deadlines, and schedules are on track. You will also be responsible for managing resources and overseeing all aspects of projects. 
Key Responsibilities: 
Define project scope, goals, and deliverables that support business goals in collaboration with senior management and stakeholders. 
Develop full-scale project plans and associated communications documents. 
Effectively communicate project expectations to team members and stakeholders in a timely and clear fashion. 
Liaise with project stakeholders on an ongoing basis. 
Estimate the resources and participants needed to achieve project goals.

Track project milestones and deliverables. 
Develop and deliver progress reports, proposals, requirements documentation, and presentations. 
Determine the frequency and content of status reports from the project team, analyze results, and troubleshoot problem areas. 
Proactively manage changes in project scope, identify potential crises, and devise contingency plans. 
Define project success criteria and disseminate them to involved parties throughout the project life cycle. 
Conduct project post mortems and create a recommendations report in order to identify successful and unsuccessful project elements. 
Develop best practices and tools for project execution and management.

listJob.name: Technical Scrum Master (Agile) - Hanoi
listJob.location: Capital Place, 29 Lieu Giai, Ngoc Khanh Ward, Qu·∫≠n Ba ƒê√¨nh, H√† N·ªôi
listJob.description:
Are you a Technical Scrum Master that can still code and test when your team requires it? Do you have experience in product development and desire to build high performing teams? If so, read on.
 About our Team
Our team is responsible for creating a brand of new digital financial platforms and apps that are highly reliable and scalable using modern engineering practices. You will be joining a project which talented software engineers in our Digital Bank Build team who is responsible for designing, building and maintaining the new digital banking platform and the customer channels. As part of the team, you will be responsible for implementing software features, involve in technical designs and writing tests to ensure the high-quality delivery of the product. The teams operate in Scrum and DevOps model.
 About the Job
We are looking for an experienced and versatile Technical Scrum Master who will be responsible for building a new scrum team for the delivery of one of our new fintech products.
The Scrum Master critical responsibility is for the team and for optimal flow of work to DONE. Scrum Masters are expected to do this by setting the pace for delivery and being proactive in planning and forecasting for upcoming deliverables. To be successful in the role you should demonstrate pragmatism in your approach and be sensitive to the environment that we operate in, using your skills and knowledge to appropriately influence the delivery approach.
 We are seeking a motivated individual with:
Excellent English speaking and written skills. (Mandatory)
Foster an open, honest and transparent relationship with key stakeholders
Excellent presentation and facilitation, coaching and mentorship skills
Strong stakeholder management and communications experience
Strong ability to influence cross-functional teams and leadership
Demonstrate assertiveness, being the voice of reason and authority
Must be enthusiastic and bring high-energy to the delivery team
Responsible for continuous delivery and management of technical debt
Previous experience leading small teams while still being hands-on.
Check out  to unveil the daily life of TymeX‚Äôs Technical Scrum Masters!
listJob.jobExperience:
At least 2+ years recent experience as a Scrum Master.
Accountable for the quality of agile ceremonies including daily scrums, sprint planning, showcases and retrospectives.
Ability to provide constructive and timely feedback to delivery team members and stakeholders.
Conflict resolution within/between delivery team and stakeholders.
Ability to negotiate priorities and timelines with stakeholders.
Setting the pace/cadence for delivery and motivating teams to succeed.
Ensuring the delivery team commits to their definition of done.
Visual representation and management of work in the sprint e.g. card walls and burn-up charts.
Management of the Master Story List (MSL), ensuring it is adequately maintained, stories are up to date and ready to play into a sprint.
Knowledge of at least 3 of the following areas:
Mobile: iOS or Android
Web: HTML5, CSS3, Angular JS, JavaScript
Microsoft .NET (C#, ASP, Framework), SQL Server
Quality Assurance, Automation Testing
Web Security, OWASP
Java, Oracle
DevOps, Continuous Delivery
listJob.privilege:
You‚Äôll love working with us if you are:
Passionate about technology.
Independent but also a good team player.
Comfortable with a high degree of ambiguity.
Focused on usability and speed.
Keen on presenting your ideas to your peers and management.
At TYME, opportunities are here for the taking. If you want to be part of our purpose and live and lead through our values, we can offer exciting development opportunities through expanded lateral roles, stretch assignments, or people leadership.
Some of our benefits:
Meal and parking allowances are covered by the company.
Full benefits and salary rank during probation.
Insurances such as Vietnamese labor law and premium health care for you and your family.
SMART goals and clear career opportunities (technical seminar, conference, and career talk) - we focus on your development.
Values-driven, international working environment, and agile culture.
Internal Hackathons and company events (team building, coffee run, etc.).
13th-month salary and performance bonus (pro-rated).
15-day annual leave + 3-day sick leave per year from the company.
Work-life balance 40-hr per week from Monday to Friday.
